item.title: GitHub Pages Easter Egg: Deploying Multiple Pages
item.description:
My sleep schedule has been messed up lately; I was still working on deploying my Github Pages at 2 AM

After finishing my extra shift, I went to eat, and just after eating, I felt sleepy. I returned around 8:30, feeling drowsy, so I thought I’d doze off for a bit, but ended up falling asleep directly. I woke up at over 2 AM.

Short-lived category: AI Study Group

Expose hypocrisy; debunking; prove wrong

We said yesterday we wouldn’t mess with the frontend, but today we’re focusing on the UI/UX experience instead

Project

We’d like to invite our old friend, https://github.com/ttf248/ai-coding-demo

That’s right, it’s the original self-selected stock project. The entire project structure is being refactored, and all subsequent AI programming content will be placed under this project.

Deploy multiple Pages

The project is currently hosted domestically at https://cnb.cool/ttf248/ai-coding-demo. Due to well-known restrictions, publishing pages isn’t supported within China, so we need to publish it on a foreign GitHub.

The blog is published on GitHub. I haven’t tried it, but it’s for publishing multiple projects as pages. Also, the current project isn’t a traditional blog site; it just contains lots of documentation and several static HTML designs.

That’s right, I discovered that deploying multiple projects as Pages doesn’t affect blog publishing; instead, it adds a new path under the blog’s domain

https://ttf248.life/ai-coding-demo/

Seeing this, I can’t help but exclaim “perfect!”

AI Study Group

I created a new category yesterday, thinking of using AI to learn many computer science courses, such as algorithms and LeetCode practice questions

Each learning record will be published on my blog, forming a knowledge base. A new category has been created: AI Study Group.

For each course, create a new project and document your learning notes in the project’s Readme.md file

item.title: Old habits, dazzling flowers captivate the eyes
item.description:
Having focused on backend development for many years, I recently started exploring italicized and bolded frontend interfaces to implement one, but in reality, these attempts haven’t been particularly helpful for my current work and have instead scattered my focus

Applicable scenarios for AI

AI tools can be particularly effective in small projects, especially when writing functions that are independent, have low system coupling, and feature simple business logic. These tasks typically involve clear inputs and outputs with limited context dependencies, making them well-suited for current AI-assisted programming capabilities.

However, AI’s limitations become apparent when dealing with complex system architectures or deep business logic. It may generate code that appears reasonable but is actually detached from the project’s actual needs, and even introduce potential issues difficult to debug. In these scenarios, AI is better suited as an assistive tool rather than a fully relied-upon code generator. We need to rigorously review and test the generated code to ensure it meets practical requirements.

The Cost of Mistakes and Learning

While attempting to generate frontend code using AI, I encountered numerous challenges. As frontend isn’t my area of expertise, troubleshooting issues proved time-consuming and draining. Even with prompt adjustments for AI rewrites, low-level errors were difficult to avoid. This repeated trial and error not only wasted time but also highlighted that my efforts are better focused on the backend’s business logic rather than exploring unfamiliar territory.

Reflecting on the project completed this weekend, I’m even more convinced that focusing on backend development and user interaction logic, implementing functionality through the console, is currently the most efficient approach. Systematically learning frontend knowledge later, when I have more time and energy, might be a better strategy.

Frontend learning plan

The front-end tech stack is complex and diverse, making it unrealistic to quickly master. I plan to focus on one framework initially, such as Vue.js or React.js, and deeply learn its core concepts and usage. Only after gaining a solid understanding of the fundamentals should I attempt AI-assisted code generation for the front-end, to effectively avoid errors and wasted time due to unfamiliarity.

For now, the focus should remain on backend development and steadily building core skills. Explore the combination of frontend and AI when the time is right; that may yield greater rewards.

item.title: Claude4 released, attempting development: Hugo tag, hyperlink translation assistant
item.description:
This site is built with Hugo, but I’ve been using Chinese titles, which results in unfriendly URLs. To put it simply, when shared, they don’t look good because Chinese characters are encoded as things like %E4%BD%A0%E5%A5%BD. While slugs can fix this, manually setting them each time is too much trouble.

So, today I tried using Claude4 to develop a translation assistant that automatically converts Chinese titles into English slugs and adds hyperlinks within articles. This would eliminate the need for manual setup.

Claude 4 is excellent; its ability to understand context and handle complex tasks has been significantly improved

Project address

Domestic project address: PROTECTED Overseas project address: PROTECTED

Code implementation

Here’s the translation: First, let me outline the approach: We need to scan all articles, extract tag information and article titles, then call a local large language model (like gemma-3-12b-it) for translation

In practical development, compared to previous generations of large models, it not only supports the statistics and analysis of tags but also includes classification statistics and can even detect unlabeled article previews and generate tag pages

Whether connecting to local large models, adding translation caches, or conducting large-scale code refactoring, Claude4Everything was completed in one go, with almost no issues. Although the project wasn’t large-scale, it included many small features. Previously, large language models often forgot earlier context during development, but this time…Claude4 performs exceptionally well, rarely losing context

In short, with improved intelligence, we’re preparing to switch to PROTECTD_INLINE_CODE_0 for more development work as our primary coding model

Translation cache

This approach, aside from reducing large model calls, offers good efficiency when running a 12b model locally without causing delays. However, repeatedly calling the large model can still be slow. Secondly, to maintain article links, full updates sometimes produce inconsistent results due to long titles, leading to link changes – which is quite awkward.

Feature optimization

The entire project was handed over to [REDACTED], who analyzed areas for optimization and provided the following suggestions:

配置外置化 - 提高可维护性和灵活性
结构化日志 - 便于问题排查和监控
性能监控 - 了解系统运行状况
用户体验 - 进度条等视觉反馈
错误处理 - 更完善的异常处理机制
代码组织 - 更清晰的模块划分

The code review was completed and everything looks good. For example, the configuration file now automatically generates a default if one doesn’t exist when reading it, converting previous configurations to defaults – this prevents user errors.

Requirements: While translating the main text, dynamically calculate the current translation efficiency, estimate the remaining time, and output relevant information to the console. This includes tracking the number of characters obtained from the article, the number of characters translated per line, the elapsed time, a fitted calculation for the translation time per 100 characters, and an estimated remaining translation time for the entire article.

The code is done, but I’m not very satisfied with the results, so I asked AI to provide new design suggestions

  • Provides multiple efficiency calculation methods: real-time efficiency, average efficiency, sliding window efficiency
  • Improved display methods: progress bar, segmented statistics, dynamic refresh
  • Add more useful metrics: API call count, success rate, etc

After completing the code, I discovered a new surprise – real-time statistics on translation efficiency are displayed without mindless scrolling

item.title: The multifaceted impacts of the family planning policy: profound changes from social structure to economic politics
item.description:
China’s family planning policy, while limiting population growth, curbed familial development, disrupted traditional social structures, and suppressed the expansion of family businesses and political dynasties. Compared to South Korea’s chaebols and India’s family monopolies, its uniqueness is evident. Now that birth restrictions have been lifted, despite challenges like low birth rates, new monopoly risks must be guarded against, requiring a balance across various stakeholders.

The Rise and Fall of Population Control and Family-Style Development

The family planning policy, a fundamental national policy in China for nearly forty years, has yielded significant results. Data shows that between 1978 and 2007, the natural population growth rate decreased from 12‰ to 5.2‰, reducing births by over 400 million, and China’s share of the world population fell from 22.2% to 20.1%. This sharp decline in population growth has profoundly reshaped Chinese society’s family structure. For example, in family businesses, the number of children born to owners significantly decreased: birth rates of three or more children dropped from 40.63% before the policy to 18.46% afterward, while single-child births increased from 6.25% to 32.31%. This structural change has directly led to a substantial reduction in the pool of potential internal successors for family businesses, objectively inhibiting their ability to expand across generations.

Comparing South Korea and India, the differences are striking. Although South Korea has not implemented strict family planning policies, its birth rate has been persistently low (0.7 in 2023). However, chaebols maintain a firm grip on the national economy through cross-shareholdings and inheritance tax avoidance. The combined revenue of the five largest chaebols accounts for over 50% of South Korea’s GDP, with Samsung alone contributing 20%. India presents a different picture: family businesses contribute 79% of economic output, and six conglomerates control key sectors like telecommunications and steel. Twenty top companies account for 80% of the profits earned by all enterprises nationwide. The core difference lies in China’s family planning policy, which restricts family size and weakens the human resource base for family business expansion from the outset. Due to different policy environments, South Korea and India have allowed family influence to continuously permeate the economic sphere.

Restraining Monopolies and Social Structure Transformation

The impact of the family planning policy on the economic sphere is particularly evident in its suppression of monopolies. Reduced daughter numbers have prevented Chinese family businesses from forming chaebol-like groups, similar to those in South Korea. For example, Korean chaebols maintain control through “circular investment,” with families like Samsung holding only 2% of shares but controlling everything through a complex equity structure. In China, family businesses after the implementation of family planning often face the challenge of “succession,” leading them to introduce professional managers or implement diversified shareholding reforms. A study by The Paper found that the proportion of female successors in family businesses increased from 13.85% to 34.21% following family planning, with a significant increase in their educational attainment – the percentage with bachelor’s degrees or higher rising from 43.75% to 98.46%. While this transformation hasn’t completely eliminated family control, it has significantly reduced the possibility of monopolies dominated by single families.

At a societal level, the family planning policy accelerated the breakdown of the traditional family core model. Household size in China decreased from 4.41 people per household in 1982 to 2.62 in 2020, weakening the family’s functions in areas such as economics, education, and social support. In contrast, India maintains a household size of around 4 people, with the caste system deeply intertwined with familial power, resulting in limited social mobility. The shift towards smaller families in China has created space for individualistic development; by 2023, there were 240 million single adults, and the consumption market is seeing the rise of a “one-person economy,” further diluting the influence of family economics.

Decentralization of power in the political sphere

The family planning policy has had a profound impact on the political landscape as well. Traditionally, familial influence permeated local politics through kinship and marriage ties. For example, in Xinyi County, Henan Province, 161 political families virtually controlled all government departments, with 20% of cadres at the deputy section level or above being “second-generation officials.” However, the implementation of the family planning policy reduced household size, limiting the expansion of familial networks. Research from Peking University shows that the number of children among officials decreased after the policy was implemented, leading to a significant decline in the complexity of political family networks. Furthermore, the policy promoted education (increasing average years of schooling from 5.2 in 1982 to 10.9 in 2023), fostering social mobility and weakening the monopoly of familial influence on political resources.

Comparing South Korea and India, the deep entanglement of Korean chaebols with politics (such as financial transactions between Samsung executives and the government) and the hereditary family politics under India’s caste system highlight the uniqueness of Chinese policy. China’s birth planning policies have objectively reduced the possibility of power inheritance. While familial phenomena still exist in county-level politics, the overall trend is a dispersal of power structures. During the 2025 National People’s Congress, a CPPCC member proposed renaming the “Law on Population and Birth Planning” to the “Population and Fertility Law,” fully relaxing birth restrictions – a move that could further influence the evolution of future political ecology.

Challenges and Opportunities After Policy Adjustments

The implementation of the two-child policy in 2016 and the three-child policy in 2021 marked a significant shift in China’s birth policies. However, the effects have been limited: the birth rate in 2022 was only 1.18, far below the replacement level (2.1). Relaxing birth restrictions has a dual impact on family businesses: some entrepreneurs may strengthen their ability to pass down their legacy through having more children, as exemplified by Zong Fuli of Wahaha Group succeeding her father; conversely, high childcare costs (averaging 1 million yuan to raise a child to 18 in first-tier cities) and declining willingness among working women to have children are restricting family expansion.

Releasing restrictions on childbirth could spur new monopolies in the economic sphere. The three-child policy is driving consolidation within industries like maternal and infant care, with the early childhood education market projected to reach 162.13 billion yuan by 2025. Leading companies are integrating smaller firms through mergers and acquisitions, resulting in a CR5 concentration exceeding 55%. While this consolidation may increase efficiency, it also poses monopolistic risks. The government must balance encouraging childbirth with preventing excessive market concentration – for example, strengthening antitrust regulation while providing childcare subsidies (such as the 3000 yuan monthly milk powder subsidy for families with three children in Hangzhou) to alleviate household burdens.

Easing birth restrictions may subtly impact family influence in the political sphere. While restoring traditional networks of familial politics is difficult in the short term, a rise in larger families could create new grassroots political influence over time. Therefore, refining cadre selection mechanisms and strengthening oversight (such as establishing rules to prevent relatives from holding positions) remain key to preventing power inheritance.

International Lessons and Future Prospects

The experiences of South Korea and India demonstrate a close relationship between the rise and fall of family power and policy direction. South Korea achieved economic takeoff by supporting conglomerates (chaebols) but at the cost of social equity. India’s lack of effective policies to curb family monopolies has exacerbated wealth inequality. China’s birth planning policy, while controlling population growth, objectively suppressed the expansion of family influence, but also brought about issues like accelerated aging and labor shortages.

Looking ahead, China needs to seek a new balance between population policy and socioeconomic development. This involves increasing birth rates through supportive policies (such as extended maternity leave and universal childcare facilities), while strengthening antitrust enforcement to prevent family businesses from forming new monopolies through financial operations. In the political sphere, further progress is needed in grassroots democracy construction, improving oversight mechanisms, and ensuring transparent governance.

Overall, the family planning policy, as a significant driver of social change in China, has had an impact far beyond the population sphere. It reshaped family structures, economic models, and the political landscape, providing a path for China to avoid falling into a Korean-Indian style trap of familial monopolies. As policies adjust, balancing efficiency with fairness, freedom with order within this new demographic context will be a long-term challenge for China.

item.title: Too much AI, some side effects
item.description:
Since the establishment of INLINE_CODE_0, there’s been a surge in recording and publishing trivial things using AI. Consequently, time for quiet reflection has diminished. It would be better to slightly control the output of this column and consolidate it into a monthly publication, releasing one article per month.

It’s like a lingering effect or side effect – efficiency increases, but depth and breadth of thought decrease

Efficiency improvement: Undeniable

Previously, this column wasn’t well-maintained. Due to laziness, I didn’t search for information or compile records on some trending events. Now, with various AI tools, outlining is sufficient; the AI can automatically search and record related events, generate articles, and after simple formatting, they can be published.

This is like a dream come true for those who don’t want to put in too much effort; it significantly boosts efficiency, almost achieving results with half the work

Efficiency significantly improves when coding instead of writing articles. Many code sections previously required detailed review of API documentation; now, this step can be skipped – a necessary shortcut. Familiarity with APIs is best left to AI.

Junk content

Many of the submissions lack substance; they feel lifeless and stale, like chewing wax—not a style I previously enjoyed

To put it another way, AI-generated content often feels like mass-produced work, lacking soul

Internet junk of the new era

Forgetfulness

This type of article is AI-generated. I don’t know the readers, and over time, my own memory will fade or even disappear.

Similar issues arise when coding – without reviewing the commit history, it’s impossible to know your original thought process or rationale for a particular implementation. This is especially true with code generated after extensive revisions and discussions with AI, which can significantly diverge from the initial idea, even becoming entirely different.

Search

I’ve noticed a significant decrease in how often I use Google and Baidu recently; searching with AI is much better than traditional search engines, both in terms of interaction and results

Let’s commemorate INLINE_CODE_0, one of the earliest AI tools connected to the internet released by a major company

People are using Google less; visits to INLINE_CODE_0 have decreased as well. Many questions can now be answered directly by AI, and this website is gradually being phased out by the times.

Conclusion

The blog I’m still maintaining doesn’t get much traffic anyway, and certainly won’t now; it’s more of a personal journal for my own reference

item.title: Trade war put on hold
item.description:
The 2025 trade war tariff evolution showed a cycle of “escalation — retaliation — consultation,” shifting the US-China competition from tariff confrontation to rules-based competition. While short-term easing alleviated market pressure, long-term uncertainty remains; monitor the WTO rulings, supply chain adjustments, and geopolitical changes’ continued impact on the global economy.

People cannot earn money beyond their understanding. The stock market crash triggered by the trade war this year, even with a partial recovery now, has claimed countless retail investors.

Timeline of Trade War Tariffs in 2025

Here’s a breakdown of the 2025 trade war tariff timeline, incorporating key events from China, the US, and other countries to illustrate the evolution of tariff policies

I. April 2025: Comprehensive Tariff Escalation and Retaliation

  • The White House revised an executive order, raising the total tariffs on China to 145%, and increasing duties on small parcels (e.g., raising the tariff rate on goods under $800 from 90% to 120%)

  • The EU is imposing tariffs of up to 25% on US goods, while Japan expressed concerns over tariffs on US cars, calling the trade war “lose-lose.”

May 2025: Geneva Talks and Tariff Easing

  • China will suspend 24% of retaliatory tariffs, retain 10%, and remove non-tariff measures

  • High tariffs are causing small and medium-sized enterprises to fail (e.g., Amazon sellers forced to close due to surging tariffs), and inflation expectations are rising (core PCE is projected to rise to 3.3%)
  • China has tightened controls on rare earth exports, cracked down on smuggling, and impacted US military and new energy industries, forcing them to seek waivers for tariffs on key minerals like rare earths

III. Other Key Events and Long-Term Impacts

  • WTO Director-General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala warned that U.S. tariffs could cause a 1% decline in global trade volume by 2025, exacerbating the difficulties faced by developing countries.

Timeline Summary

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
The US is imposing 34% retaliatory tariffs on China, covering goods from Hong Kong and Macau
The US will raise tariffs on China to 84% and introduce new tax orders
China retaliates with tariffs, initially 34%, later raised to 84%; US modifies tariffs to 145%

China, US, and Japan Geneva talks result in a joint statement agreeing to suspend 24% tariffs (for 90 days)
Both sides announced suspension of tariffs and a consultation mechanism, easing trade tensions

Trends and Challenges

  • The tariff suspension between China and the US sends a positive signal, but structural issues (such as high technology and energy) remain, and midterm elections may affect policy continuity
  • Companies are accelerating supply chain adjustments; Mexico and Southeast Asia benefit from “nearshoring,” but rising costs may curb recovery
  • The WTO dispute settlement mechanism is limited, and regional trade agreements (such as the US-UK agreement) have become alternative options, but this exacerbates fragmentation

item.title: Jiangxi Provinces Special Post & National Civil Servant Teacher Recruitment Data (2020-2025): Trends and Insights
item.description:
Jiangxi Province’s teacher recruitment from 2020-2025 shows a significant reduction trend: Special post teacher hiring decreased sharply from 6,617 to 32 (a 99.5% decrease), and national cadre teachers dropped from 11,324 to 2,146 (an 81.1% decrease). While the proportion of core subjects (language, math, English) remained stable, the overall volume contracted. Though the proportion of arts, music, and physical education increased, absolute numbers were limited (e.g., only 2 recruits in 2025 for each subject). Policy shifts towards “one-in, one-out” staffing restrictions, with teacher resources directed toward vocational education and remote areas, have led to a substantial reduction in traditional primary and secondary school positions; some subjects had zero planned hires in 2025.

A table summarizing the number of special-post teacher recruitment announcements in Jiangxi Province over the past five years, categorized by subject

——————

Based on recruitment announcements and public data released by the Jiangxi Provincial Department of Education, Human Resources and Social Security Department, and other official bodies, here’s a summary of special post teacher and national cadre teacher recruitment from 2020-2025. Please note that some information is incomplete, and subjects marked as “not subdivided” in the table represent total statistics or missing data.

Data Description

  1. 趋势分析:

item.title: Merge Pull Request into forked repository
item.description:
INLINE_CODE_0 is a GitHub profile statistics generator that allows users to display various statistics and charts on their GitHub profiles. It offers multiple customization options to suit user needs.

I manage my warehouse by project groups. GitHub doesn’t support grouped repositories, so I had to use separate organizations. The latest branch couldn’t handle cross-organization repository statistics, so I forked a branch and merged the corresponding code.

Final effect

Original Pull Request Link

Adds the ability to include data from organization repositories

Merge Pull Request into forked repository

There are several ways to merge a [BLANK_0] into your [BLANK_1], depending on what you want to achieve

  1. Merge the PR from 上游（upstream）仓库 into your fork, or
  2. Merge a PR from another person’s fork into your own fork, or
  3. Merge a pull request opened on your fork (e.g., someone created a PR from their fork of yours)

Here’s the translation: I’ll give you a very common scenario: 你 fork 了一个仓库，想把上游的某个 PR 合并到你的 fork. The operating procedure is as follows 👇:

Method 1: Command-line method (most universal)

Step 1: Clone your own fork 

git clone https://github.com/你的用户名/仓库名.git
cd 仓库名

Step 2: Add upstream (original repository address) 

git remote add upstream https://github.com/原作者用户名/仓库名.git

Step 3: Fetch the upstream PR branch

Find the PR number you want to merge, for example, PR #123

You can pull the code for this PR like this:

git fetch upstream pull/123/head:pr-123

Step 4: Switch and merge branches 

git checkout main    # 或者你自己的目标分支
git merge pr-123

If everything is normal, you can push to your forked GitHub repository

git push origin main

Method Two: GitHub Web Interface (Simple but Limited)

If you see a pull request on GitHub that is against an upstream repository, you can:

  1. Go to that PR page
  2. Click the “Commits” or “Files changed” in the upper right corner to see which branch this PR is based on
  3. On your forked repository, create a new branch and manually cherry-pick the PR’s commits (requires some Git knowledge)
  4. Or click “Open in GitHub Desktop” to merge using a GUI tool

If someone has submitted a pull request for your fork

Simply go to the PR page and click the “Merge pull request” button

Would you like me to walk you through it step-by-step, based on your current situation (e.g., a PR link, whether you’re using the web interface or command line)? Or, you can provide a specific link, and I’ll help you analyze the simplest approach

item.title: Commit messages in Git history
item.description:
This script is used to batch modify author information in Git history, rewriting commit records using git filter-branch

The provided script for batch modifying author information in Git repository history is conceptually correct, but (does not support array syntax)

To improve compatibility, it is recommended to replace the array with a space-separated string and iterate through each old email address using for. Here’s an example of the modified script:

#!/bin/sh

git filter-branch --env-filter '
OLD_EMAILS="TianlongXiang51@gmail.com nick@qq.com tianlongxiang51@gmail.com"
CORRECT_NAME="tianlong.xiang"
CORRECT_EMAIL="tianlong.xiang@foxmail.com"

for OLD_EMAIL in $OLD_EMAILS
do
    if [ "$GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL" = "$OLD_EMAIL" ]
    then
        export GIT_COMMITTER_NAME="$CORRECT_NAME"
        export GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL="$CORRECT_EMAIL"
    fi
    if [ "$GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL" = "$OLD_EMAIL" ]
    then
        export GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="$CORRECT_NAME"
        export GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="$CORRECT_EMAIL"
    fi
done
' --tag-name-filter cat -- --branches --tags

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

  • Before running this script, it is recommended to back up your repository to prevent unexpected issues

  • This operation will rewrite Git history, modify commit author information, and may cause changes to commit hashes

  • If you have already pushed changes to the remote repository, you need to use a force push

    git push --force --tags origin 'refs/heads/*'

Use force pushes cautiously, especially in collaborative projects, to avoid impacting others

List all unique author email addresses in the warehouse statistics

git log --format='%an <%ae>' | sort -u

item.title: The Celestial Realm of Medical Education and the Butterfly Effect of the Dong Xi-ying Incident
item.description:
The Peking Union Medical Center “4+4” program (4 years of non-medical undergraduate + 4 years of medical PhD), emphasizing interdisciplinary elite training, was exposed in 2025 due to the Dong Xiying incident. Her entry into the program allegedly leveraged family background (a lineage of medical professionals/researchers), raising questions about her educational qualifications and allegations of plagiarism. This highlights a conflict between the program’s elitist admissions practices and fairness, alongside unresolved issues regarding shortened training periods and supervised practice concerns.

Prompt

Writing a blog post: The origins and development of Concordia 4+4. Key points: A corner of Heaven, seen by mortals; Miss Dong’s family background; it’s impossible for a normal medical PhD to graduate in eight years; Miss Dong’s family and educational backgrounds.

The Disintegrated “Palace” of Medical Education: UnionMed 4+4

The “4+4” program at Peking Union Medical College, launched in 2018, has been regarded as a “heavenly palace” for medical education in China. Designed to emulate the American medical education system and guided by the principles of attracting individuals with diverse backgrounds, cultivating those with a passion for medicine, and recruiting talent from across the globe, it seeks to break new ground within the traditional medical education framework. Its core logic lies in 用4年非医学本科教育+4年医学博士培养，替代传统的5+3+3（本科5年+硕士3年+博士3年）模式, aiming to cultivate leading medical professionals with interdisciplinary expertise.

This pattern’s “Celestial Palace” attribute is reflected in three dimensions:

  1. Initially, applicants were required to have graduated from universities ranked within the top 50 by QS/Times/US News or among the top 10 US News liberal arts colleges (such as Barnard College). While later relaxed to include schools ranked in the top 100, a GPA of 3.6 or higher, or being in the top 30% of their class is still required.
  2. Utilizing an American organ-system integrated curriculum and PBL (Problem-Based Learning) teaching methods, students must complete core courses such as anatomy and pathology within four years, alongside clinical internships
  3. Although the passing rate for the licensing exam (95.2%) was slightly lower than the traditional eight-year program (98.5%), graduates largely enter Peking Union Medical Center affiliated hospitals, and their career development shows no significant difference from the traditional path

The Dong Xi-ying Incident: Cracks in “Heavenly Palace” Seen by a Mortal

In April 2025, a report of extramarital affairs involving Dr. Xiao Fei, a thoracic surgeon at the Sino-Japanese Friendship Hospital, unexpectedly exposed the “mystery” surrounding Peking Union Medical Center’s 4+4 project. The resume of the involved party, Dong Xiuying, raised three points of concern:

  1. 学历背景的模糊性:
  • Dong Xiyi claims to have graduated from Columbia University, but in fact attended its affiliated Barnard College (ranked 14th by US News for liberal arts colleges in 2025). Although Barnard meets the “top 20 liberal arts college” requirement, its diploma simultaneously lists “Barnard College” and “Columbia University,” which can easily be mistaken for Columbia’s main campus in the domestic recruitment market.
  • The path of a bachelor’s degree in economics followed by a doctorate in clinical medicine, while meeting the “multidisciplinary background” requirement of the 4+4 program, has been questioned for lacking a foundation in pre-medical coursework. Furthermore, his doctoral dissertation, “Research on Multi-Modal Image Fusion Technology in Medical Image Analysis,” has been accused of significant similarity to a Beijing University of Science and Technology invention patent, raising concerns of academic misconduct.
  1. 家庭背景的特殊性:
  • His father is a secretary at China Metallurgical Research Institute, his mother is an associate dean at the Beihang University Engineering Technology Research Institute, his grandfather is an academician in the field of imaging at Peking Union Medical College, his maternal grandparents are foreign academicians in materials science, and his aunts and uncles are professors at Beihang University. This “medicine + research + university” family background provides him with hidden resources such as letters of recommendation (requiring two biomedical associate professors) and research collaborations (such as patents from Beihang University).
  • During residency, he switched from thoracic surgery to urology, with research spanning multiple fields including orthopedics, gastroenterology, and imaging, leading to accusations of “paving the way with resources.”
  1. 学制争议的放大:
  • Traditional medicine doctoral programs require 11 years (5+3+3), while the 4+4 program compresses this to 8 years. Despite Peking Union Medical College’s emphasis on “integrated curriculum” and “early clinical exposure,” some doctors note that its clinical internship time (12 months) is less than the traditional eight-year system (18 months), potentially impacting skill development.
  • Some training bases allow a one-year reduction in required training for 4+4 graduates, raising concerns about fairness within the industry

The Dilemma of Medical Education Behind the Controversy

The Dong Xi-ying case reflects the deep-rooted contradictions in China’s medical education system

  1. 精英化与公平性的冲突:
  • The “application-review system” of the 4+4 program is essentially a transplant of the American medical school model, but China lacks standardized exams like the MCAT, and subjective evaluations such as letters of recommendation and research experience are easily influenced by family background
  • Data shows that among the 2023 graduates (4+4 program), 30% came from Tsinghua, Peking University, and Fudan University, 25% from overseas prestigious universities, indicating a significant influence of family background on applications
  1. 学制改革的现实困境:
  • Research output (e.g., publications) from 4+4 medical students is significantly lower than that of traditional eight-year programs, leading to criticism of prioritizing clinical experience over research
  • Top-tier hospitals prioritize the Peking Union Medical Center brand, while community hospitals are cautious about the clinical abilities of 4+4 program graduates
  1. 医学教育的国际接轨之惑:
  • The US 4+4 model requires passing the MCAT and completing 3-7 years of residency, while China’s 4+4 program simplifies admission and residency, resulting in a superficial resemblance
  • According to data from the Ministry of Education, in 2024 nationwide medical doctoral program admissions, programs following the 4+4 model accounted for less than 5%, and their widespread promotion still faces challenges

Reconstructing the “Celestial Palace” Order of Medical Education

The controversy surrounding the Union 4+4 project is fundamentally a clash between elite education and public expectations. When a corner of “heavenly palace” (referring to top-tier medical training) is glimpsed by ordinary people, it exposes not only flaws in individual cases but also deep-seated contradictions within the entire medical education system. Future reforms need to focus on three levels:

  1. Introduce standardized exams (like China’s version of the MCAT) to reduce the influence of subjective factors such as letters of recommendation
  2. Restore the internship period for 4+4 graduates to 3 years to ensure clinical competency standards are met
  3. Establish an academic integrity review mechanism, with rigorous originality verification for interdisciplinary research

Medical education should not be a privilege for a few, but a true incubator for medical excellence. Only when fairness in selection, rigor in training, and standardization of career development are comprehensively ensured can this “medical education experiment” truly take root.

item.title: Broad-based index investing: Broker ETFs, Hang Seng Tech Index
item.description:
I always wanted to buy a solid blue-chip stock and just leave it, but I never managed to do it. When it fell, I didn’t add to my position, and when it rose, I sold it off.

Finding suitable blue-chip stocks is troublesome; it’s better to choose a broad index and buy an ETF. The current plan is: securities ETF, Hang Seng Tech Index.

This trading strategy has a professional term: left-side dip buying

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

Broker ETFs

Securities ETF refers to exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that primarily invest in listed securities broker stocks within the Chinese stock market. Securities ETFs typically track a specific securities brokerage index, such as the China Securities Index.

I bought it before, but chased after the price and ended up losing money, so I cleared out my position. In China’s market, every bull market sees brokerages rise; how much they rise depends on investor sentiment.

Hang Seng Technology Index

The Hang Seng Tech Index is a stock index launched by the Hong Kong Exchange, designed to reflect the overall performance of the technology sector in the Hong Kong market. It includes major tech companies listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, covering areas such as internet, e-commerce, cloud computing, and artificial intelligence.

As of May 20, 2025, the top ten constituents and their weightings in the Hang Seng Tech Index (code: 800700) are as follows (data compiled from multiple authoritative sources):

  1. 舜宇集团 (舜宇光学科技集团有限公司) (01810.HK): Approximately 8.82%
  2. China Resources Pharmaceutical Holdings (00700.HK): Approximately 8.14%
  3. Country Garden (09988.HK): Approximately 7.72%
  4. 京东集团-SW (09618.HK): Approximately 7.60%
  5. 舜宇光学科技集团有限公司 (Sunvision Technology Co., Ltd.) (03690.HK): Approximately 7.35%
  6. (01024.HK): Approximately 6.10%
  7. Bold (02015.HK): Approximately 6.09%
  8. 中芯国际 (00981.HK): Approximately 5.70%
  9. (09999.HK): Approximately 4.59%
  10. Approximately 4.48%

Approximately 66.6% (some sources indicate a combined share of the top ten between 68%-69%, with differences due to varying statistical time points)

Key Notes

  1. The Hang Seng Tech Index caps the weighting of any single stock at 8%. For example, SMIC’s weighting previously exceeded 8% before adjustments in March 2025 but was subsequently reduced to comply with this limit.
  2. On May 16, 2025, Hang Seng Index Company announced that BYD (01211.HK) will be added to the index and China Literature (00772.HK) removed. The adjustment will take effect on June 6. Therefore, as of today (May 20), the constituent stocks are based on the pre-adjustment list; BYD is not yet included.
  3. The top ten components are dominated by internet technology companies (such as Tencent, Alibaba, and Meituan), with significant weighting in new energy vehicles (Xiaomi, Li Auto) and semiconductors (SMIC), reflecting the index’s coverage of technology and the new economy
  4. Differences in data from various sources are primarily due to differing statistical time points. For example, data from March 2025 shows the top ten combined share at approximately 69.4%, while data from May 14th indicates 68.82%, reflecting the dynamic impact of market fluctuations on weighting.

Add to position on a pullback (on the left side)

A “left-side topping up” strategy is an investment approach where investors buy in batches during a sustained stock price decline, anticipating the price is nearing a bottom to reduce holding costs and profit from future price increases

This method falls under the category of “left-side trading,” meaning taking a counter-trend position before the market has clearly bottomed out. In practice, investors typically employ a “pyramid” accumulation strategy, gradually increasing buy quantities as the price declines to lower their average holding cost. For example, initially buying a certain number of shares; if the price continues to fall, they increase their buying volume at a lower price, and so on.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

  • Buying in batches during a downturn can lower average cost basis and set the stage for future profits

  • Establishing positions before the market reverses can yield greater returns when the trend improves if your judgment is correct

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

  • If the stock price continues to fall, it may lead to greater losses

  • Adequate financial support is required for continuous restocking, and there’s a risk of funds being locked up long-term

Relatively speaking, “right-side trading” involves buying after a clear market trend and price recovery signal, offering lower risk but potentially missing early gains. Therefore, investors should choose a strategy that aligns with their risk tolerance, financial situation, and market judgment.

Valuation theory

Valuation theory is a core concept in finance, aiming to assess the intrinsic value of assets or companies and provide a basis for investment decisions. Through valuation, investors can determine whether the current market price of an asset is reasonable and formulate corresponding investment strategies.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

  1. This method is based on the expected future cash flows of an asset, which are then discounted to their present value using an appropriate discount rate. The DCF method emphasizes intrinsic value and is suitable for evaluating companies with stable and predictable earnings.

  2. This method assesses a company’s relative value by comparing its valuation metrics (e.g., P/E, P/B, P/S) to those of comparable companies in the same industry. Relative valuation is easy to implement and widely used for quick assessments and peer comparisons.

  3. This method determines a company’s value by assessing its net asset value, which is the difference between total assets and liabilities. The asset-based approach is suitable for asset-dominant companies such as real estate firms or capital-intensive businesses.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

  • Through valuation, investors can identify undervalued or overvalued assets and formulate buy-or-sell strategies

  • In M&A transactions, valuation is key to determining the transaction price and influencing its success

  • The company needs to fairly value its assets and liabilities to ensure the accuracy and transparency of financial statements

It’s important to note that valuation results are influenced by various factors, including market conditions, company operations, and macroeconomic indicators. Therefore, a comprehensive consideration of all factors, combined with qualitative and quantitative analysis, is necessary to achieve more accurate assessments.

item.title: Design and develop a customizable stock selection module (without coding)
item.description:
We tested Cursor last month, but due to free tier limitations, we didn’t develop complex features, just simple testing. We noticed that ByteDance also released a similar product at the time, both using the same underlying large language model: Claude-3.5.

ByteDance’s product, Trae, initially launched a Mac version and finally released a Windows version this February. Big company products are just good – you can use them for free without paying, with unlimited access to Claude-3.5, which is a very impressive model.

Ultimately, development stalled on the K-line chart due to my limited knowledge of React. To continue, I need to supplement my frontend skills and break down tasks into smaller steps instead of tackling a large project like developing a K-line chart directly.

Issues found

  • Due to insufficient training data for Vue3 + Element-Plus due to reliance on foreign AI models, we chose React as the frontend framework
  • There may be occasional grammatical errors that require manual correction
  • Some complex problems require human guidance for solutions
  • Code structure optimization requires human guidance

The most time-consuming part was packaging the frontend code into a container. As someone with zero experience, I had no understanding of this process; I only managed to grasp the logic with help from others. There’s a significant difference in how frontend development checks code between dev and build modes. The database and service containers for the backend took about five minutes combined.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!

Warehouse address

As the title suggests, we’re skipping the coding and directly discussing with AI to design and develop a custom stock selection module. Let’s see what kind of results we can achieve.

Warehouse address: https://github.com/ttf248/trae-demo

Detailed usage instructions can be found in the repository’s README.md file

The repository contains numerous submission records, mostly conversations between me and Trae, along with my tests of various features for him. Notes indicate whether manual intervention was required to implement the corresponding functionality.

Prompt

This project was created from scratch. Here’s the prompt for the project:

基于项目原型图，开发功能：自选股，需要支持合约的新增、删除、修改、查询。自选股界面需要展示基础的行情数据。支持多个不同的市场切换。

前端：react
后端：golang gin gorm
数据库：PostgreSQL

服务端需要支持跨域请求，同时需要考虑数据的校验和错误处理，如果后端服务不可用，前端需要告警提示。

后端需要展示请求和应答的日志；前端也打印通讯的日志，方便排查问题。

UI and interaction optimization

The frontend design is entirely dependent on Grok. We initially created a prototype within Trae, but it lacked aesthetic appeal. Due to the model’s strong coding capabilities and weaker overall abilities, we need to use Grok to optimize the frontend UI.

By taking screenshots of the current interface, uploading them to Grok, and having it help us optimize the UI, we can potentially receive numerous optimization suggestions. We will then manually evaluate these suggestions and copy them into Trae for execution, observing the results.

Technology stack

  • Frontend: React + TypeScript
  • Backend: Golang + Gin + GORM
  • Database: PostgreSQL 17

item.title: Two years of AI development: Its somewhat like the state before Docker was released
item.description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) has undoubtedly been one of the most discussed topics in technology in recent years, especially with its rapid advancements over the past two years. From deep learning and natural language processing to computer vision and automated decision systems, AI applications are constantly emerging. However, despite continuous technological breakthroughs, AI still faces a bottleneck similar to that of Docker before its release – a lack of a killer application to truly ignite the market.

The development of AI over the past two years is similar to the state before Docker’s release – lacking a killer application. It needs a perfect practical implementation based on existing technology, like Docker: not relying on groundbreaking new technologies, but offering a complete and reasonable solution that transforms operations and development workflows.

The current state of AI development: technology is mature, but application still needs breakthroughs

From a technical perspective, AI has made significant progress in the past two years. Whether it’s OpenAI’s GPT series models or Google’s BERT and DeepMind’s Alpha series, AI processing capabilities have far exceeded previous expectations. Particularly in natural language processing, models like GPT-4 not only possess powerful generation abilities but also demonstrate astonishing performance in understanding and reasoning.

However, despite rapid technological advancements, the practical application of AI faces certain challenges. Similar to the state before Docker’s release, while AI has immense potential, a truly widespread and industry-transforming “killer” application hasn’t yet emerged. People discuss AI’s prospects but may struggle to find an application that can bring revolutionary change. Many AI applications remain in early experimental stages and require further integration and optimization.

The similarity between Docker and AI: Technology isn’t necessarily innovation, solutions are key

Looking back at the history before Docker’s release, we find striking similarities with the current state of AI development. Prior to Docker, container technology wasn’t new; early technologies like LXC (Linux Containers) and virtualization already possessed basic containerization capabilities. However, Docker cleverly integrated and optimized existing technologies, proposing a simpler, more intuitive, and efficient solution. This approach didn’t introduce revolutionary technology but addressed many pain points in operations and development processes, significantly simplifying software deployment, scaling, and management.

Similarly, the AI field faces a similar situation. While current AI technology is no longer “new,” achieving widespread application still requires a perfect implementation scenario – like Docker, integrating and optimizing existing technologies to form a practical solution. The “killer” application of AI may not depend on breakthrough new technologies, but rather on how to integrate existing ones to solve real-world business pain points and needs.

How to find AI’s “Docker moment”?

To achieve widespread application of AI technology, several aspects need to be addressed

  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are! Currently, many AI applications remain experimental and lack large-scale practical implementation. While areas like AI customer service and intelligent recommendations are widely used, their functionality is still limited and hasn’t yet overcome industry bottlenecks. True breakthroughs may come from industries long burdened by traditional methods—such as healthcare, manufacturing, and logistics—where AI can improve efficiency and reduce costs through more efficient data processing and predictive analysis.

  2. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are! Just as Docker improves operational efficiency by streamlining the containerization process, the usability of AI products is equally crucial. The popularization of AI isn’t just about technology; it’s about productization. Integrating AI into daily workflows and enabling users to easily utilize these tools without needing a deep understanding of the underlying technology is a key step in its successful implementation.

  3. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are! The widespread adoption of any new technology hinges on building a robust ecosystem. Docker’s rapid rise is due to its openness and compatibility, allowing developers to easily connect with various cloud platforms, tools, and services. Similarly, the future of AI depends on ecosystem development. Standardization, model sharing, data accessibility, and technical integration will all influence whether AI can achieve broad industry applications.

Conclusion: The future of AI is full of possibilities, but still requires more robust implementation plans

Despite significant advancements in AI technology over the past two years, it remains in a stage without a killer application. Similar to containerization technology before Docker’s release, AI needs a practical application scenario that deeply integrates existing technologies with business needs to achieve widespread adoption and scale. While technological innovation is important, solutions that simplify processes and improve efficiency are more likely to drive the popularization and development of the technology.

In the future, AI may not revolutionize through groundbreaking technology, but rather create a perfect application scenario by integrating existing technologies—ultimately transforming how we work and live

item.title: Protobuf Zero-Value Trap: When Defaults Become Silent Killers of Business Logic
item.description:
US stocks have three trading periods: pre-market, intra-market, and post-market. The data push logic (to minimize bandwidth usage) sends the full dataset once initially, then pushes incremental updates for all subsequent fields.

Why not use the optimal solution? It involves different project teams, some of which have been live for many years. We are newly integrated, so we can only try to maintain compatibility.

A series of questions

Looking at the abstract alone, there might not seem to be a problem. However, bringing this system architecture into the problem-solving process has triggered a series of issues. Just as one issue was resolved, another arose, stemming from the previous ones.

Unable to identify trading period

Whether the in-memory stage is defined as the default value or the actual business value

A simple understanding: Receiving a 0 each time makes it impossible to determine whether it’s a new quote setting or the default value of Protobuf

Introduce optional

Since protobuf release 3.15, proto3 supports using the optional keyword (just as in proto2) to give a scalar field presence information

The internal communication protocol is based on protobufBOLD_3optionalBOLD_4protobuf, and the project’s underlying implementation uses a static library, which requires upgrading the entire compilation chain. This cost is very high.

GCC version issue

After much deliberation, we devised a plan to release two different versions at the underlying level, aiming to carefully control new features

Commonly used server types within the group: CentOS 7, CentOS 8. The default version of CentOS 7 is above 7.4, so CentOS 7 is not supported.

Bug 82461 - [7 Regression] Temporary required for brace-initializing (non-literal-type) member variable。

After some troubleshooting, moving the related services and compilation server to CentOS 8 resolved the issue

Reasonable Enumeration

Looking back at the entire issue, there’s a simpler and more efficient solution: adjust the enumeration definition to start numbering from 1 instead of 0. This effectively distinguishes default values from business values, avoiding the aforementioned series of problems.

Why is starting from 1 more reasonable?

In C++, the default value of an enumeration type is fixed at 0. If we define a meaningful business value as 0 (e.g., “in-plate”), the downstream system cannot determine whether the received 0 represents a business value or an unset default value during incremental push. However, if enumerations are defined starting from 1, 0 can be reserved for a meaningless default value or an “unknown” state, resolving the issue.

Suggested practices:

When designing Protobuf enums, always define 0 as a meaningless default value Assign actual business values starting from 1, ensuring distinction from the default value of 0

This small adjustment not only resolved the trading period identification issue but also provided a valuable lesson for future protocol design

item.title: A dramatic market shift before and after National Day: soaring highs followed by plunging lows
item.description:
Ahead of China’s National Day holiday in 2024, the stock market saw a remarkable surge, followed by a dramatic plunge after the break. This “rollercoaster” experience for investors has prompted deep reflection on policy, economics, and market dynamics.

Here’s the English translation: “Written as a news report, this blog post focuses on the stock market surge preceding last year’s National Day holiday, followed by the subsequent sharp decline after the holiday.”

Stock market surge before National Day: A policy-driven frenzy

For the five trading days leading up to China’s National Day in 2024, the Chinese stock market surged from a slump into a “boiling” state. On September 30th, A-share markets saw broad gains with significant volume; major indices all reached historic highs. The Shanghai Index rose 8.06%, the Shenzhen Component Index climbed 10.67%, and the Growth Enterprise Market Index soared 15.36%. The B share index set a record for the largest single-day increase, jumping 22.84%. Market sentiment was extremely bullish, with daily turnover on Shanghai, Shenzhen, and Beijing exchanges reaching 2.61 trillion yuan – a substantial increase of 1.1559 trillion yuan from the previous trading day. Over 5300 stocks across all markets rose collectively, creating a “sea of red” scenario.

The driving force behind this recent market rally stems from the concentrated release of a series of unexpected government policies and the resulting shifts in market expectations. On September 24th, the People’s Bank of China announced measures including cutting the reserve requirement ratio, lowering interest rates, reducing mortgage rates on existing loans, and unifying minimum down payment ratios for mortgages. The Central Political Bureau meeting on September 26th emphasized increasing counter-cyclical adjustments through fiscal and monetary policies to boost capital markets and encourage long-term funds to enter the market. On September 30th, a cluster of four real estate support policies were introduced. These measures demonstrate the government’s determination to stabilize the market and economic growth.

Post-National Day Stock Market Plunge: Calmness and Adjustment After the Celebration

However, market sentiment plummeted after the National Day holiday. On October 8th, A-shares opened strongly with near limit-up gains, but following this sharp opening, the market experienced significant volatility, ultimately closing higher than it opened but lower than it closed. Since then, the market’s focus has continued to decline; as of October 16th, the Shanghai Composite Index saw a swing of over 15% and a cumulative drop of more than 470 points. From October 8th to 10th, core A-share indices across the board declined, with the Growth Enterprise Market Index falling by 6.21%. This recent sharp decline is due to a combination of factors: digesting risks accumulated from previous rapid gains, and adjustments in market expectations regarding policy. Some investors believe the short-term effects of policies are already apparent, while long-term results remain to be seen. Volatility in overseas markets has also impacted A-shares. On October 9th, the Hang Seng Index plummeted 9.41% and the A50 futures contract fell 10.4%, further intensifying the market’s downturn.

Reflection on and Prospects for the Market

The sharp market fluctuations before and after National Day have prompted deep reflection on policy, the economy, and market dynamics. While policy stimulus has shown a significant short-term effect, its long-term impact remains to be seen. The rapid market rises and falls also serve as a reminder for investors to remain rational and avoid emotional investing.

Whether A-share market can achieve a genuine “long-term bull” trend still depends on whether policies effectively reach the real economy and ultimately drive substantial improvements in economic fundamentals. Investors should closely monitor policy implementation and changes in economic data, adjusting their investment strategies accordingly.

The stock market’s surge and subsequent crash around National Day were a contest between policy and the market, as well as a test of investor psychology. This “extreme” volatility revealed both the power of the market and the influence of policy. We will see how the market unfolds next.

item.title: Nezha breaks out during Spring Festival season
item.description:
For Chinese people, watching movies has become an essential entertainment during the Spring Festival season when families reunite. This year’s Spring Festival film releases were dominated by “Ne Zha,” which was incredibly popular and sparked widespread discussion. The buzz surrounding it is reminiscent of “Wolf Warrior,” both films carrying a strong patriotic theme that evokes a sense of national pride.

The unexpected success of “Nezha” during the Spring Festival season, sparking a sense of national pride reminiscent of films like “Wolf Warrior,” demonstrates a patriotic theme. While acknowledging significant progress, the film isn’t quite as impressive as some claim. As a gamer, I find many aspects feel overly slick and the fight scenes lean heavily towards an MMO style. Numerous reports indicate people buying tickets to see it but ultimately not going due to its performance pressure.

The fight scenes lack texture

As a gamer, I usually spend my days immersed in online games and didn’t have high expectations for movies. But the buzz around “Ne Zha” was undeniable; everyone was talking about it, so I figured I’d check it out. Once I entered the theater and saw the visuals, I felt a jolt. While the production quality has improved considerably, some scenes looked a bit greasy. And the fight sequences? They were too heavily influenced by online game aesthetics. Having played games for so long, this visual style is too similar to certain in-game environments, lacking the texture one expects from a film.

Crazy movie fans

After seeing the movie, I checked online and saw that quite a few people bought tickets for “The Devil’s Child” but didn’t actually watch it, all to boost its box office. That’s impressive dedication – clearly, there’s a lot of enthusiasm for this film, and everyone wants to do something to support it.

Plot

Let’s recall “Wolf Warrior” when Wu Jing shouted, “Whoever dares offend China will be punished no matter how far away they are,” many people were thrilled and felt that our Chinese military was so powerful, and our country so strong. While “Ne Zha” doesn’t have such direct patriotic slogans, it vividly showcases traditional Chinese culture. We grew up listening to the stories of mythological figures like Nezha and Ao Bing; the film portrays their conflicts, love, and growth with depth and emotion – isn’t that the charm of Chinese culture?

Let’s talk about Nezha. Misunderstood and looked down upon since childhood, yet he refused to give in, declaring “My fate is my own, not the heavens’.” That spirit is so much like the resilience ingrained in us Chinese people. No matter how great the difficulty, we don’t back down, but strive to change our destiny through effort. Ao Bing also exemplifies this – burdened by a family mission, seemingly cold but truly kind-hearted, willing to sacrifice himself for his friends. We often see such friendship and responsibility in real life, don’t we?

Advancement of animated films

Although “The Devils Who Laugh” isn’t perfect, it effectively combines traditional Chinese culture with modern film technology, showcasing the progress of Chinese animation. Just as “Wolf Warrior” demonstrated a breakthrough for Chinese cinema in action films, this kind of advancement gives us hope that Chinese movies can shine on the international stage and allow foreigners to appreciate the brilliance of Chinese culture.

As Chinese people, wherever we go, we carry our nation and culture in our hearts. Films like “Ne Zha” and “Wolf Warrior” are like keys, unlocking a sense of national pride deep within us. They allow us to experience the strength of our country and the charm of our culture amidst laughter and joy, inspiring us to work hard in our respective fields and contribute to the prosperity and development of our nation. This is likely why these films have become so popular and resonate with such strong feelings of national pride. We hope for more films like this in the future, to keep this sense of pride brimming.

item.title: Troubleshooting TCP Communication Anomalies in Backend Services
item.description:
Business model: The backend service establishes a connection with the group’s market gateway via TCP. Each connection requires an initial authorization request, followed by continuous heartbeat packets to maintain connection status. However, one day, an alert about a service disconnection was received. After carefully checking the logs, it was discovered that the backend service continuously sent heartbeat packets, but there was no response from the other party, yet the connection never disconnected.

Brief Overview

I was working late at the office, pushing forward project progress, when an alert suddenly popped up in our work group. At first glance, I thought it was just a network timeout causing heartbeat failures and service disconnections. However, after carefully checking the logs, the situation proved to be different. The backend had sent authorization login messages, but received no response. Meanwhile, heartbeats continued to be sent, yet there was no reply whatsoever. In-depth analysis of the logs revealed several key issues:

  1. Authorization message failed due to no response: This is likely because the other system is restarting, preventing timely processing of the authorization message
  2. The heartbeat data was sent despite unsuccessful authorization. Investigation revealed a flaw in the program logic: the heartbeat sending function’s judgment logic is defective, only checking connection status but omitting authorization status verification.
  3. If the service can disconnect, it will trigger a reconnection mechanism to resend authorization messages

Currently, one last critical issue remains: why the connection has not been disconnected. Resolving this requires more in-depth and detailed troubleshooting.

Analyze network packets

To capture network packets for further analysis

Analyzing the data in the graph, I can see that the heartbeat was consistently being sent, but no data was received from the other server. However, it provided ACK, which prevented the connection from disconnecting automatically.

Common Flag Explanations

In the TCP protocol, INLINE_CODE_0（Push）和 INLINE_CODE_1 (Acknowledgments) are two important flags used to control data transmission and flow confirmation. Their functions are as follows:

1. PSH（Push Flag）

  • 功能: Request that the receiver immediately push the data from the buffer to the upper-layer application’s data segment, processing and forwarding it as quickly as possible rather than storing it in the operating system buffer

  • 典型场景:

  • Clients expect immediate responses from the server when sending requests (e.g., ping)

  • Each keyboard input triggers PSH, ensuring real-time character transmission

  • Low-latency scenarios such as video streaming and online games may use edge computing to reduce latency

  • 注意:

  • This flag is not mandatory; the recipient can choose to ignore it (but should still process the data normally)

  • The sender may not set PSH, in which case the receiver will decide when to push data based on its own buffering strategy

2. ACK（Acknowledgment Flag）

  • 功能: Confirmation that the preceding data segment has been correctly received (indicated by the expected next byte sequence number). It is a core mechanism for reliable transmission in TCP.

  • 工作原理:

  • When sending a data segment, the sender will carry the expected recipient’s (ID)

  • Upon receiving the data, the receiver generates an acknowledgment segment confirming the received sequence number

  • The sender will only retransmit unacknowledged data after receiving the corresponding confirmation

  • 示例:

  • If the sender sent sequence number 5, 6, and 7

  • If the recipient does not receive confirmation from the sender regarding retransmission
