item.title: Making money takes time; rushing it wont help
item.description:
Reflecting on years of stock trading, while I haven’t made a fortune, I also haven’t lost too much. The biggest issue is an unreasonable cash flow plan and unstable mindset. Currently, my primary income comes from work – a fixed salary. My tolerance for financial fluctuations remains at the level of bonds and bank deposits. However, people are inherently greedy; buying too little means you won’t profit when prices rise, while buying too much leads to losses when they fall. A stable mindset is therefore crucial; it helps steady our ship of wealth.

Investing through stock trading: The importance of mindset

Historical Loss Cases

Besides dabbling in small-cap and newly listed stocks when I first started, the investments I’ve focused on since have been primarily blue-chip large-cap stocks: Industrial Bank, China Unicom, Hengan Electronics, ZTE, and various large-cap index funds

Ultimately, it stemmed from greed wanting more—rushing to increase holdings at the start, then facing a cash flow crisis. Expenses like insurance, buying property, and getting married were major drains on funds; the overall plan lacked sufficient financial buffer, leading to later shortages.

Buy blue-chip stocks, it’s like relying on [someone] dependable

  • When Evergrande ran into problems, bank stocks plummeted, allowing for a successful opportunity to sell off. However, this demonstrates a flawed understanding of the broader economy – real estate’s share in the national economy is too significant, with far-reaching implications that cannot be ignored. The subsequent market decline and the sustained rise of dividend stocks over roughly two years reflect this.
  • The early stages of the trade war saw significant damage, with stock prices falling sharply, but they gradually recovered afterward
  • This stock belongs to the former employer. After Ant Financial’s divestiture, the price dropped significantly, but it has market makers who can push it up several times a year. With proper position sizing, losses will be minimal.

Greed: The “monster” that devours reason

When stock prices rise steadily and investors’ paper profits increase, greed quietly takes root. Many, seeing prices already at high levels, still fantasize about continued upward trends and seek greater returns, unwilling to take profits. Blinded by greed, they forget market rules and the existence of risk. For example, during speculative surges in certain hot-topic stocks, some investors, witnessing short-term doubling or even multiple times increases, become deeply involved, continuously adding positions with the hope of being the last winners. However, markets don’t stay exuberant forever; when bubbles burst and prices plummet, these greed-driven investors often suffer heavy losses. Greed robs them of their ability to analyze and decide rationally, turning them into “gamblers” rather than wise investors.

Fear: Shackles binding your hands and feet

Fear is the opposite of greed. Fear is equally destructive in the stock market. When market conditions turn sharply downward and prices plummet, investors easily panic. This fear erodes their confidence; even with fundamentally sound stocks, they rush to sell to avoid further losses. For example, during the global financial crisis, many high-quality blue-chip stocks also fell dramatically. Some investors, overwhelmed by fear, failed to recognize the long-term value of these companies and sold their shares at rock-bottom prices, missing out on substantial returns from subsequent market rebounds and company performance growth. Fear not only causes short-term losses but can also create a lasting psychological shadow, deterring them from re-entering the market and causing them to miss investment opportunities.

Blindly following trends: A “fog” that obscures direction

Blindly following the crowd is another common psychological trap for investors in stock trading and wealth management. In an era of information overload, investment advice, market rumors, and trending news abound. Many investors lack independent thinking and judgment skills, blindly imitating others’ actions. Seeing others profit from buying a particular stock, they rush to buy without careful consideration; hearing so-called “insider tips,” they invest everything they have. This blind following neglects the necessary research and analysis of individual stocks, leaving investors lost like ships in fog, losing their direction. For example, some concept stocks may generate short-term gains for followers initially, but as hype fades, prices plummet, turning those unaware and blindly following into “bag holders.” They fail to realize that each investor has different risk tolerance, investment goals, and time horizons; what works for others might not work for them.

Overconfidence: A Hidden “Shoal”

Overconfidence is a significant issue in the mindset of stock and financial investments. After experiencing initial investment successes, some investors become inflated with pride, believing they have mastered market patterns and can accurately predict price movements. They disregard the complexity and uncertainty of the market, leading to excessive trading, blindly expanding their investment scale, and even using high leverage for speculation. However, the market is unpredictable, and overconfident investors often suffer significant losses from unexpected market fluctuations. For example, inexperienced but initially successful investors may believe they possess professional investment skills and begin frequent buying and selling while continuously increasing their investments. When systemic risks or negative news about individual stocks emerge, they fail to stop their losses in time due to their overconfidence, resulting in substantial capital erosion. Overconfidence is like a submerged reef, appearing calm and harmless on the surface but capable of wrecking an investor’s financial ship unexpectedly.

How to adjust your mindset for sound financial management

  • Establish a correct investment philosophy: Investors should understand that stock trading and wealth management are for the long-term, stable growth of assets, not for getting rich quick. Through learning investment knowledge, understanding market patterns, and adopting value investing and long-term investment principles, avoid being swayed by short-term gains and market sentiment. For example, thoroughly research a company’s fundamentals – its profitability, industry position, management team, etc. – to select stocks with long-term investment value, rather than blindly chasing short-term trends.
  • Develop a sound investment plan: Based on your financial situation, risk tolerance, and investment goals, create a scientific and reasonable plan. Clearly define key elements such as investment amount, timeframe, expected return, and stop-loss point, and adhere to the plan strictly. This helps avoid impulsive decisions driven by emotional fluctuations. For example, limit each stock’s allocation to a certain percentage of your total assets; take profits when prices reach your target gains, and cut losses decisively when they hit your stop-loss level.
  • Control your emotions and stay calm: When facing market volatility, learn to manage your emotions and remain calm and rational. Relieve investment pressure through methods like distraction, exercise, and communication. Avoid letting emotions negatively impact your investment decisions. When the market experiences significant fluctuations, first calmly analyze the reasons, combine your investment strategy with the fundamentals of the stocks, and make a rational judgment instead of blindly following trends or panicking.
  • Continuous learning and reflection are essential in the ever-evolving stock market. Investors must consistently acquire new knowledge and skills, stay informed about macroeconomic trends, industry developments, and company information to improve their investment capabilities. Regularly reflecting on investment behavior, summarizing lessons learned, identifying issues with mindset and decision-making, and making timely adjustments are also crucial. For example, after each investment, review the entire process, analyze successes and failures, and consider how to avoid similar errors in future investments.

Investing in the stock market is a long and challenging journey where mindset plays a crucial role. Maintaining rationality, composure, humility, and independent thinking are essential for navigating market volatility and achieving wealth preservation and growth. Investors should consider cultivating a positive mindset as a fundamental part of their investment process, enabling them to steer their financial future successfully.

item.title: Alternative fantasies and emotional attachments shaped by time
item.description:
As the earliest online literature readers enter middle age, the genre has evolved. Protagonists now frequently appear as fathers, mentors, or elderly individuals, catering to middle-aged readers’ changing needs for life and emotion. These works no longer solely focus on leveling up and defying the odds; instead, they emphasize emotional resonance and life reflections.

Target audience: Evolving readership over time

Former online literature readers are now mostly middle-aged. Having experienced life’s challenges, their perspectives and values have shifted. The youthful pursuits of action and adventure no longer hold the same appeal. Instead, they seek emotional resonance with their current lives, memories of past years, and hopes for the future through reading. Middle-aged “爽文” (refreshing/satisfying novels) emerged to meet this psychological need, attracting readers with storylines that closely reflect the realities and mindset of middle-aged individuals.

Character Transformation: From Young Hero to Middle-Aged Responsibility

After becoming a master, the protagonist Lu Zhou faces a group of apprentices with diverse personalities and formidable strength. They waver between good and evil, while Lu Zhou must guide them towards righteousness. This novel explores the challenges and dilemmas faced by a middle-aged person teaching the next generation through interactions between the protagonist and his apprentices. The growth and transformation of these apprentices also offer readers hope and a glimpse into the future, reflecting their own expectations for their children or younger generations.

Emotional Resonance: Reflections on Life and Family Responsibility

The protagonist gains a system on their 60th birthday, embarking on a new life journey. This premise resonates with middle-aged readers by offering a sense of “it’s not too late” hope and inspiration. Despite reaching old age, the protagonist can still realize their value and dreams through the system. This storyline prompts reflection on missed opportunities and unfulfilled aspirations, while also conveying a positive attitude towards life, encouraging people to pursue their goals at any age.

Plot design: Reflecting the rhythm and fun of middle-aged life

Plots in mid-life “refreshing” novels often focus more on life’s details and nuanced emotional expression. Unlike the fast-paced leveling and adventure common in younger works, they prioritize relationships and emotional conflicts between characters. For example, in “Strongest Master,” the detailed portrayal of the master-apprentice bond and brotherhood among peers resonates with readers, evoking feelings of warmth and familiarity—a reflection of their own familial, friendly, and romantic experiences.

item.title: The Mystery of Spring Festival Movie Ticket Prices: Differences Between Online and Offline Sales
item.description:
During the Spring Festival, a family of seven or eight wanted to see a movie. We planned to buy tickets on Taopihao and Maoyan, but saw the price was 60 yuan. Luckily, we had a cinema recharge card that required purchasing tickets at the front desk in person. Thinking to ask about any discounts, we were surprised to find the same showing only cost 35 yuan there – quite a difference!

Hidden platform fees

While online ticketing platforms offer convenience, their service fees are significant. They invest in user-friendly features like seat selection and purchase history tracking, which require funding. These costs are passed on to the customer through service fees, resulting in higher ticket prices.

Cinema Differentiation Strategies

Demand for movie tickets during the Spring Festival is surging, and theaters are using tiered pricing to maximize profits. Online platforms have high traffic, so many people buy tickets in advance online, resulting in higher prices for those tickets. Meanwhile, walk-in customers buying at the front desk receive lower prices to attract them.

The pricing logic behind profit sharing

Online platforms and cinemas cooperate through revenue-sharing models that affect ticket prices. To ensure profitability, platforms take a percentage of the box office, leading to higher ticket costs. Cinema counters, without intermediary fees, offer more affordable tickets due to lower costs.

Tips for Buying Tickets

Don’t just look at online platforms when buying tickets. Try calling the cinema directly or visiting the front desk – you might find a surprise. If you’re a frequent moviegoer, consider getting a membership card to enjoy member discounts and save money.

item.title: An Analysis of Political Elements in 2025 Spring Festival Films
item.description:
It’s been a while since I went out during Spring Festival season, but this time I saw two movies and had a different feeling

This article explores the new trends in the 2025 Spring Festival film season, focusing on “Detective Chinatown 1900” and “New Deity: The Magchild Incites the Sea.” The former uses the backdrop of San Francisco’s Chinatown in 1900 to depict the discrimination and oppression faced by Chinese people, reflecting the social and political environment. The latter, as an animated film, employs rich metaphorical elements to satirize the current international political landscape—for example, Jade Pure Palace resembling the Pentagon alluding to the American political system, dollar signs on the Tianyuan Cauldron symbolizing US dollar hegemony, the Immortal Jade Tablet mirroring the green card suggesting hierarchical status, and the Soul-Destroying Pill akin to biological weapons hinting at malicious actions. Both films offer a new viewing experience and prompt reflection on the relationship between cinematic art and political expression.

Innovation in Spring Festival film styles

Traditionally, Spring Festival films have been lighthearted and family-friendly, aiming to help audiences relax during the holiday season and rarely addressing sensitive political topics. However, this year’s 2025 Spring Festival lineup breaks with convention; “Detective Chinatown 1900” and “New God of War: Nezha Revolution” incorporate rich political elements, sparking widespread discussion among viewers and ushering in a new era for Spring Festival films.

A Vivid Reflection of the Era’s Politics

“The Lost Tiger” is set in 1900 San Francisco’s Chinatown, a time when Chinese immigrants faced severe racial discrimination and oppression. As the protagonists investigate a case, they must navigate not only the mystery but also societal prejudice and unfair treatment. The film’s portrayal of racism and power struggles realistically reflects the social and political climate of the era, revealing the arduous struggle for survival and dignity undertaken by Chinese immigrants during that turbulent time—a situation with underlying political issues worthy of deeper consideration.

This historical context inevitably brings to mind the current challenges faced by overseas Chinese in the business world, such as the TikTok and Zhou Shuzhong incident

On December 6, 2024, local time, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit rejected TikTok’s request, upholding the constitutionality of a law requiring its sale on national security grounds. TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew wrote in a memo to employees that the next step will be “seeking an injunction and awaiting review by the U.S. Supreme Court.” The event stems from the “Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications” law, which mandates that ByteDance divest its U.S. TikTok operations within 270 days of the bill’s passage, with a final sale deadline of January 19, 2025.

Previously, Shou Zi Chew faced numerous challenges at various hearings. On January 31, 2024, during a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on “Big Tech and the Online Child Sexual Exploitation Crisis,” prominent anti-China lawmaker Tom Cotton repeatedly questioned him with 8 nationality-related inquiries, including his own citizenship, whether he had applied for Chinese or American citizenship, and even the nationalities of his wife and children. Despite the hearing’s focus being on online child sexual exploitation, the senator shifted the topic to TikTok’s ownership by the Chinese company ByteDance, forcing Chew to answer questions unrelated to the theme. Similar to the unwarranted discrimination faced by Chinese in “Detective Chinatown 1900,” Shou Zi Chew is experiencing unfair treatment and scrutiny in the business world due to TikTok’s background. These events reflect that overseas Chinese have consistently encountered significant external obstacles when pursuing their own development and protecting their rights across different eras. Whether it was racial discrimination a century ago or today’s political maneuvering in commerce, these situations warrant deep reflection.

An Analysis of the Political Metaphors Behind “Ne Zha: The Demon Child”

While appearing as an ordinary animated film, “Ne Zha: The Demon Child” is rich with political allegories in its settings and plot

  • The Jade Void Palace is portrayed as the supreme power center of the realm, with an architectural style similar to the Pentagon, predominantly white in color, symbolizing Western powers using “universal values” as a pretext for hegemony. The “Demon Eradication Team,” led by the Limitless Immortal Elder, and its subordinates, Lù Nán and Hè Nǚ, are seen as corresponding to the US alliance system involving Japan and South Korea. The Jade Void Palace’s “online meeting” scene, with the Twelve Golden Immortals discussing the “War of the Conferred Gods,” mirrors a NATO summit led by the United States, ostensibly maintaining order while suppressing other nations.
  • The Tianyuan Cauldron, used for alchemy in Yuxu Palace, features dollar signs at its entrance, symbolizing how the United States “alchemizes” resources from other nations through economic hegemony. In the film, Wuliang Xianweng throws the dragon clan into the cauldron under the guise of “acting on behalf of heaven,” mirroring certain countries exploiting others by leveraging “international rules.”
  • Nezha’s immortal identity jade pendant, with its color and design resembling the U.S. green card, symbolizes the celestial realm’s exclusion and stratification of “outsiders,” hinting at the identity differences and unequal treatment between different countries and groups in reality.
  • The forced consumption of the Soul-Destroying Pill by Nezha, compelled by the Immortal Wonderman, resembles a bioweapon and satirizes certain nations that, under the guise of “saving the world,” engage in destruction and devastation abroad
  • The Seven-Colored Treasure Lotus, crucial for reshaping the bodies of Nezha and Ao Bing, symbolizes energy and technology lifelines monopolized by powerful nations. Obtaining its “essence” requires passing the Yu Xu Palace’s “immortality exam,” reflecting developing countries’ dependence on core resources and exploitation within a hegemonic system. The lotus’s temporary failure and recovery conditions allude to small nations’ survival challenges amidst energy crises.

A Deep Reflection on Film Art and Political Expression

These films, integrated with political elements during the nationwide Chinese New Year moviegoing boom, offer audiences a new viewing experience—no longer just entertainment, but more like a mirror reflecting political issues within history and reality. This prompts deeper reflection on the relationship between cinematic art and political expression. Will directors increasingly convey their views on society and politics through film? Can cinema, as a powerful cultural medium, balance artistic expression with greater attention to and contemplation of social realities? These questions warrant thorough exploration while enjoying films, and we look forward to more exciting developments from the film industry in fusing art and reality.

item.title: The two major U.S. political parties—the Democratic Party and the Republican Party.
item.description:
The Democratic and Republican parties have significant differences in political ideology, policy proposals, and social values

Political Ideology and Policy Proposals

  • The Democratic Party leans liberal, advocating for government involvement in economic and social matters. It supports social welfare programs, environmental protection, and multiculturalism. On taxation, the party favors tax cuts for low-to-middle income groups while raising rates on high earners and corporations. Regarding social issues, it supports abortion rights, same-sex marriage, and strict gun control. In foreign policy, the Democratic Party emphasizes multilateralism and diplomacy, preferring to resolve global issues through international cooperation.

  • The party leans conservative, advocating for limited government intervention and emphasizing individual freedom and a market economy. On tax policy, they support across-the-board tax cuts, believing they should benefit all income levels. Regarding social issues, they oppose abortion and same-sex marriage and support the right to bear arms. In foreign policy, they tend towards a hawkish stance, supporting the use of military force to protect national interests.

The significance of Trump’s rise to power

Donald Trump’s re-election as U.S. President in 2024 signifies the Republican Party’s dominance in American politics. Trump’s policy positions include:

  • Trump advocates for economic growth through tax cuts and deregulation, particularly supporting the development of traditional manufacturing and energy industries. He also favors protectionist trade policies, renegotiating or withdrawing from existing trade agreements to protect American economic interests.

  • Trump plans to strengthen border security, restrict illegal immigration, and impose stricter screening and limitations on legal immigrants. He also supports limiting refugee and asylum claims to protect national security.

  • Trump favors unilateralism, emphasizes “America First,” reduces reliance on international organizations, reassesses relations with allies, and employs tougher diplomacy when necessary. He also plans to expand fossil fuel production and usage while easing environmental restrictions.

A second Trump term could lead to significant shifts in US domestic policy and have far-reaching impacts on global politics and economics. His policies are likely to draw international attention and responses, particularly regarding trade, environment, and human rights.

item.title: Deploy DeepSeek-R1 locally
item.description:
Ollama is an open-source AI tool designed to enable users to run and deploy large language models (LLMs) locally. It aims to provide a convenient and efficient way for developers to use models like GPT on their local machines without relying on cloud services. Ollama supports various models and focuses on optimizing performance so that even resource-constrained devices can run them smoothly.

With Ollama, users can utilize text-based AI applications and interact with locally deployed models without concerns about data privacy or high API usage fees. You can call different models through a command-line interface (CLI) for tasks like natural language processing and question answering.

Ollama is good for trying out different models. The Windows version doesn’t fully utilize hardware performance, likely due to Windows itself. The Linux version might be better. Deploying a 32B parameter model results in slow responses even with low memory and GPU load.

item.title: PowerShell 7 and Persistent Settings Command-Line Prediction View
item.description:
Having been accustomed to zsh on Linux, I recently discovered that PowerShell 7 also supports persistent settings for command-line prediction views. I tried it out and found it quite useful.

Not sure what action was taken, but this feature is enabled – it just appeared

In today’s diverse operating system environment, system administrators and developers are seeking a cross-platform, efficient, and powerful tool to meet their needs for system management and automation. PowerShell 7 is such a highly anticipated tool, offering robust scripting capabilities and enabling operation across Windows, Linux, and macOS, bringing unprecedented convenience to users.

PowerShell 7: A Powerful Cross-Platform Tool

Cross-platform features

PowerShell 7 removes platform limitations, allowing users to utilize a single tool for enterprise-level server management on Windows, system administration in Linux environments, or everyday development tasks on macOS. This significantly improves work efficiency and reduces learning costs and operational complexity caused by platform differences.

Powerful features

It features robust scripting capabilities, supporting object-oriented programming, functions, and modules. With PowerShell 7, users can easily manage the file system (creating, deleting, copying, moving files and folders), access and modify the registry for in-depth system configuration, and manage processes and services for effective monitoring and control. Furthermore, PowerShell 7 integrates with various Windows and non-Windows technologies, such as user and permission management in Active Directory and resource provisioning and management on Azure cloud platforms.

Open-source ecosystem

PowerShell 7 is open-source, enabling global developers and enthusiasts to actively participate in its development and improvement. A wealth of open-source modules and tools are constantly emerging, enriching PowerShell 7’s functionality and applications. Users can find suitable modules within the open-source community to extend PowerShell 7’s capabilities or contribute their own code to advance the entire community.

Compatibility and Stability

PowerShell 7 introduces numerous new features and improvements while maintaining compatibility with older PowerShell versions. These enhancements boost performance, increase stability, and allow users to complete tasks more smoothly, reducing interruptions due to software issues.

Open command-line prediction view

Among PowerShell 7’s many useful features, the INLINE_CODE_0 command is a practical tool that enhances the user’s command-line experience

Without enabling the command, inline auto-completion is available. Enabling it provides predictive suggestions in a list format, allowing users to select options with arrow keys, improving accuracy and efficiency of command input.

How to make commands persistent

To ensure a command takes effect each time PowerShell starts, you can add it to the PowerShell profile. The PowerShell profile is a special script that automatically executes its commands when PowerShell launches.

Confirm configuration file path

In PowerShell, we can use the $_ variable to view the configuration file path. If the file does not exist at that path, the user can create it manually.

echo $PROFILE

Open configuration file

Open the file corresponding to the configuration file path obtained through the __INLINE_CODE_0 variable using a text editor, such as the powerful Notepad++ or the lightweight Visual Studio Code

Add command

Add the INLINE_CODE_0 command to the open configuration file. Ensure the command is written accurately to guarantee it takes effect when the configuration file is executed.

Save configuration file

After adding the command, save the configuration file and close the text editor. The configuration file now includes the commands we want to execute each time PowerShell starts.

Verification Settings

Close the current PowerShell window and restart it. In the newly launched PowerShell, when entering commands, the command-line input prediction view should display in a list format, indicating that our settings have taken effect successfully.

Through these steps, we not only gained a deeper understanding of PowerShell 7’s powerful features and capabilities but also learned how to enhance the user experience by setting command-line input prediction views and ensuring these settings persist. We hope this knowledge helps you use PowerShell 7 more confidently and efficiently to complete various system management and automation tasks.

item.title: Is Modern Monetary Theory the future of global economies?
item.description:
The US stock market’s ongoing bull run, aside from America’s inherent strength, is largely due to excessive liquidity in the dollar

The modern monetary system, following the [period indicated by BOLD_0], has gradually become a key theoretical underpinning for many economies worldwide. Its main characteristic is an emphasis on the active role of government intervention in markets, utilizing government fiscal deficits as a primary tool to achieve full employment while stabilizing inflation.

Keynesian economics. It emphasizes the government’s role in cyclical fluctuations, such as suppressing during overheating and stimulating during contractions, with a strong focus on the multiplier effect of government spending – how much consumption is stimulated by each dollar spent. Government spending of one dollar increases income for businesses and individuals by one dollar, leading to expanded production, job creation, and increased consumer spending to counteract economic contraction. It also maintains relatively conservative fiscal deficit limits and sustainability. Economic recovery will boost government revenue, particularly in suppressing overheating cycles, allowing the accumulation of stimulus resources for future periods, such as government debt potential and interest rate levels.

The modern monetary system is an extension of extreme Keynesianism, but with a key difference: the limitation on government debt. Central banks should not be independent; their primary goal is to address resource and productivity-constrained inflation—that is, increasing purchasing power in the market through unlimited fiscal deficits as technological advancements boost production efficiency until full employment and production bottlenecks are reached. Further increases in money supply will then lead to inflation, at which point controlling the upper limit of the fiscal deficit becomes necessary. As long as there is idle productive capacity, increased deficits will not cause inflation.

After the financial crisis

Reality is not an ideal world. The selective application of Keynesianism, with its emphasis on stimulating economic downturns while inadequately curbing overheating, often leads to political gains. This creates a cycle where poor economic performance and overheating are both seen as achievements, making it difficult to implement corrective measures. Consequently, numerous economic problems arise, potentially leading to financial crises not unlike those caused by traditional overcapacity. The 2008 global financial crisis was essentially the result of market self-reinforcement under extreme Keynesian policies, creating a proliferation of shadow banking products—such as real estate and derivatives based on real estate assets. Even before the crisis, there was insufficient risk awareness across academia, government, and the markets, with debt-fueled prosperity being mistaken for achievement and benefiting many, particularly the financial system: they profited from losses while distributing dividends, ultimately leaving participants to bear the gains of previous stages—and often facing bankruptcy—with no possibility of returning funds.

The shadow of the modern monetary system emerges after the financial crisis, characterized by rapid expansion and so-called emergency lending policies. The central bank acts as a lender of last resort, providing unlimited liquidity, while governments can continuously accumulate debt. Coordinated policy between the central bank and fiscal authorities sees the central bank supporting government deficits through bond purchases, ensuring policy consistency. This blurring of lines between monetary and fiscal policy relies heavily on direct central bank participation in purchasing government bonds – printing money with one hand and spending it with the other.

Both the Eurozone and the United States exhibit similar trends. In 2008, EU government debt was approximately €6.7 trillion, with a leverage ratio of around 66%, slightly above the generally accepted warning line of 60%. By 2014, during the 5-year bailout period, debt reached €9.5 trillion and leverage rose to 93%. The US is even more extreme; in 2008, US government debt was around $10 trillion, reaching approximately $18 trillion by 2014. Recently, the debt ceiling was again raised, typically accompanied by threats of government shutdowns, but each time exceeding the limit. Debt currently surpasses $36 trillion, a $26 trillion increase compared to 2008. Considering GDP growth, government leverage has risen from 60% to over 120%. The Federal Reserve, as lender of last resort, played a crucial role in multiple bailouts and is also a major purchaser of government debt.

Drawbacks and Limitations of the Modern Monetary System

This government-led economic stimulus plan, though not a planned economy, faces consistent problems. How can you guarantee the omniscience of the market and the selfless dedication of all participants? Take a simple example: if a government department increases its budget by one million, will it go to a leader’s nephew or to the more cost-effective bidding process? In reality, interests are channeled in more complex ways, resulting in uncontrollable spending despite the government expanding debt and expenditures. The recent controversy surrounding the establishment of a US government efficiency agency is an extension of this issue. These issues vary in their manifestation across different economies with corruption indices, but we’re primarily discussing the underlying universal problem.

Inflationary issues

With the development of modern information networks, governments now possess far greater access to market information than in the past. However, this doesn’t equate to omniscience; the market is inherently variable and constantly shifts due to expectations, creating a self-reinforcing structure. I anticipated your anticipation. Consider the actual performance: while Modern Monetary Theory showed promise between 2008 and 2020, achieving short-term economic recovery and inflation stability (even leading to deflation in the Eurozone and keeping US inflation within the expected 1-3% range), it fostered a belief akin to past faith in Keynesianism—a trust in an increasingly extreme tool.

Looking back, the primary reason is that manufacturing in developing countries continued to show high growth after 2008. Countries like China, which solidified its global production position during this period, and emerging economies in Southeast Asia and India, maintained substantial manufacturing value-added, effectively offsetting the limitations of Modern Monetary Theory – specifically resource constraints – and enabling relatively stable inflation even as Western nations faced deindustrialization, financial excess, rising government debt, and increased money supply.

However, after 2020, with the implementation of larger-scale stimulus policies, both the Eurozone and the United States experienced significant inflation, peaking around 10%. Even today, nearly three years into interest rate hikes, the U.S. labor market continues to show excessive heat, and financial markets have seen an unsustainable boom decoupled from economic growth. As base effects fade, U.S. inflation is heading towards 3% again. This overheating during a period of rising rates is closely linked to fiscal deficits. Rate hikes represent monetary policy contraction while fiscal policy remains expansive; the massive money supply in 2020 has made U.S. inflation stubbornly persistent. High inflation is the primary limitation of Modern Monetary Theory.

Government debt issue

In principle, the government can theoretically use debt to repay debt without limits, but this requires a central bank’s willingness, that is, a lender of last resort within the modern monetary system. The Federal Reserve clearly isn’t prepared to grant the government such complete freedom; combined with decades of accumulated government debt balances, particularly interest expenses, high interest rates and increasing debt have gradually become a massive fiscal burden.

For fiscal year 2023: U.S. federal revenue was $4.439 trillion, with interest payments on debt accounting for roughly 15% of that revenue. This high-interest trend continued in 2024, according to data released by the U.S. Treasury Department. For fiscal year 2024, the U.S. federal government’s budget deficit reached $1.833 trillion, with net interest payments on debt totaling $882 billion – approximately 18% of U.S. federal revenue, exceeding Social Security expenditures.

This is the sustainability issue of fiscal policy. If low interest rates and low inflation are maintained for a long time, along with high debt (like Japan), it can indeed create an application of modern monetary theory over the long term. According to the Rule of 72, as long as interest rates are sufficiently low, incremental borrowing under a debt-funded system is very slow. With a 1% cost of funds, pure debt financing can double the debt in 72 years. If inflation disrupts this delicate balance, the accumulation of interest payments on the debt through compounding can lead to an uncontrollable trajectory for future debt; the principal becomes secondary. These issues will become even more acute if the central bank’s actions are inconsistent with the ruling party’s goals. The political agenda of the Trump administration sharply contrasted with the current hawkish stance of the Federal Reserve, which is a major source of tension in the relationship between the US government and the Fed during this term. What people are most concerned about is whether the current chairman can successfully reach the end of his term.

Financial bubbles and monetary credit issues

Ideally, government spending increases would flow to households and businesses, prompting broader investment and consumption that boosts effective demand. However, having experienced numerous financial bubbles since 2000, people now exhibit a strong preference for investment over consumption, especially when high-growth products emerge. They flock to financial markets seeking appreciation, even at the expense of quality of life and increased leverage—a pattern seen in periods of rapid growth for real estate in Japan, the US, and China. Combined with policy stimulus and practitioners pursuing their own interests, this often leads to subprime lending issues and many so-called “rescue” policies that essentially encourage debt accumulation.

History consistently shows that when monetary and fiscal policies are aggressively implemented, a bubble forms first, followed by wealth redistribution. This leads to the economic Ponzi scheme problem (Minsky moment) inherent in extreme Keynesianism or prolonged Modern Monetary Theory – as long as there’s hot money, asset prices continue to rise, attracting new investors; meanwhile, CPI measuring basic living expenses changes little, and capital stagnates in specific sectors. Eventually, newcomers find themselves unable to sustain the flow, leading to a Minsky moment judgment that invariably proves accurate.

Furthermore, currency itself is subject to supply and demand. When market supply exceeds the capacity of traditional investment assets, or when excessive harvesting fails to attract capital—such as repeated collapses in real estate bubbles (something Japanese have avoided for decades)—and tax policies suppress speculation, including increasing taxes on property ownership to reduce speculative demand, these measures increase the cost of financial speculation. In a situation where currency supply is excessive, the market urgently needs new investment assets, leading to the emergence of various virtual investments—even attracting involvement from the U.S. President and First Lady. Some say it’s poaching dollars, but in reality, it’s likely an inevitable consequence of global monetary over-issuance and financial churning undermining fiat currency credibility. Even the credit-based status of modern money theory, reliant on state monopoly rights, may be challenged—the type of environment breeds what kind of financial games.

In summary, Modern Monetary Theory (MMT) and Keynesianism share a progressive and substitutional relationship. MMT places greater emphasis on government intervention in the market and adopts a more radical stance towards fiscal deficits and central bank independence. While Keynesian policies led to stagflation and financial crises, MMT quietly took over after 2008, benefiting from continued productivity gains during globalization. It achieved rapid growth and maintained inflation levels in the short term but accumulated substantial government debt and financial bubbles. With rising inflation and conflicting goals between central banks and governments, high interest rates and leverage exacerbated the fiscal burden of servicing debt, significantly weakening fiscal sustainability. Excessive government involvement in monetary supply fueled financial bubbles and eroded the credibility of currency – the strength of the dollar is largely due to the relative weakness of others. This created fertile ground for new financial investment and speculative instruments, some even evading traditional tax limitations. This mirrors the global economy as a whole. MMT may not be the future; it’s more like a relic from 2008. Coupled with reverse globalization, the greater the past financial bubbles, government debt accumulation, and reckless speculation, the higher the risk of a hard landing – encompassing economic and social risks. Whether Keynesianism or MMT, regardless of how much money is supplied, it cannot fundamentally address wealth distribution issues; instead, it exacerbates risks within asset bubbles and Ponzi schemes. People repeatedly fall into the same trap in different ways, yet fail to learn from their mistakes.

item.title: Understanding buy rate and sell rate in exchange rates
item.description:
In the foreign exchange market, particularly at banks or currency exchange points, we often see terms like “buy rate” and “sell rate.” Many people may not be clear on these concepts, or even confuse them. Today, we will use a simple example to help everyone understand the meaning and function of these rates.

What are “buy rate” and “sell rate”?

  • Banks or currency exchange institutions are willing to buy foreign currency at this rate; that is, when you sell foreign currency (like US dollars) to a bank, the bank will pay you in RMB according to the buying rate

  • Banks or currency exchange institutions are willing to sell foreign currency at this rate; that is, when you buy foreign currency with RMB, the bank will sell it to you at the selling rate

In short:

  • The exchange rate at which the bank buys foreign currency from you
  • The price the bank offers you for foreign currency

It’s important to note that banks’ buying and selling exchange rates are typically different, with the selling rate generally higher than the buying rate. This difference is how banks make a profit.

Case Study Analysis

To help everyone better understand the practical application of these exchange rates, let’s take a specific example:

Suppose you go to a bank to exchange for US dollars, and the bank’s exchange rate is as follows:

  • 1 US dollar = 7.0 Chinese yuan
  • 1 US dollar = 7.2 Chinese yuan

Scenario 1: You sell US dollars to a bank

Assuming you have $1,000 and want to sell it to a bank, the bank will calculate using its buy rate

\[ $1,000 USD x 7.0 CNY/USD = 7,000 CNY \]

That means the bank will give you 7,000 RMB. The exchange rate is 买入汇率, as you are selling dollars to the bank.

Scenario 2: You buy US dollars with RMB

Assuming you have 7,000 RMB and want to exchange it for US dollars, the bank will calculate using the selling rate:

\[ $972.22 USD \]

In this case, 7000 RMB can be exchanged for approximately 972.22 USD. The exchange rate is 卖出汇率, as you are purchasing dollars from a bank.

Why is the buy rate different from the sell rate?

You may have noticed that the bank’s selling exchange rate (7.2 RMB/USD) is higher than its buying exchange rate (7.0 RMB/USD). This is because banks typically profit from foreign exchange transactions by exploiting this difference. In other words, banks make a profit by charging a higher selling rate and paying a lower buying rate.

For example, in the above case, the bank’s spread is:

\[ Selling exchange rate (7.2) - Buying exchange rate (7.0) = 0.2 RMB \]

This difference is the bank’s source of profit

Conclusion

  • The bank buys foreign currency from you at this exchange rate (the rate when you sell foreign currency)
  • The bank sells foreign currency to you at this exchange rate (the rate when you buy foreign currency)
  • The difference between the buying and selling exchange rates is the bank’s profit margin

Understanding these exchange rate concepts allows us to better know how much foreign currency we will receive or how much Chinese Yuan is needed to purchase it when exchanging currencies. Hopefully, this simple example helps everyone better understand the basic principles of foreign exchange rates!

item.title: Loading mismatched PDB files in Visual Studio
item.description:
When debugging a program in Visual Studio on Windows, if the PDB file doesn’t match the executable, you’ll receive a “Failed to load symbol file” error. Program crashes and resulting dump files will also fail to allow smooth entry into the crash scene if the PDB is mismatched.

What is a pdb file?

PDB files are debugging information files created by Microsoft, used for program debugging. They contain information such as symbol tables, source file names, and line numbers. PDB files are generated during compilation to aid in debugging.

Debugging with WinDbg

WinDbg is a debugging tool from Microsoft that can be used to debug Windows programs. WinDbg can load mismatched PDB files, but requires manual loading. The __INLINE_CODE_0 command can force the loading of mismatched PDB files.

However, WinDbg is less convenient than Visual Studio, so we want Visual Studio to also load mismatched PDB files

Visual Studio loading mismatched PDB file

item.title: Cursor AI programming IDE trial
item.description:
Another year has passed. The biggest change at work is the noticeably increased involvement of AI. Previously, switching between different development languages required developers to be familiar with various APIs. Now, these basic code snippets can be generated by AI – a great boon for developers.

ChatGPT

Back in 2023, I revised two introductory articles. Now it’s 2025, and frankly, there hasn’t been a significant improvement. It still requires developing one’s own understanding, being able to reasonably break down tasks, and most importantly, identifying bugs in AI-generated code.

Github copilot

I can’t recall the exact date, but I saw information stating that Singapore has deployed servers for domestic use. This means we no longer need to constantly use a VPN; only a VPN is required for login, after which it can be turned off.

I use Github Copilot more often; this plugin can be used directly in VS Code and Visual Studio without switching between programs. item.title: C++ Bitwise Operations Fundamentals: Bit Extraction and Flag Setting
item.description:
In practical C++ development, bitwise operations are a common technique, particularly when handling system states, flags, or control bits. This article will explain how to use bitwise operations to get and set specific flag bits through an example.

Basic operating concepts

In computers, data is stored as binary digits (bits) of 0 and 1. Bitwise operations are operations performed on these bits. C++ has several common bitwise operators:

  • Checks if a bit is 1
  • Sets a specific bit to 1
  • Used to invert a bit
  • Reverse all bits
  • Shift all bits several positions to the left
  • Shift all bits right by several positions

In this case, we need to perform a series of bit operations on a bold italicized value to represent different states using various flag bits

flowchart LR
    A[原始数值: 00010000] --> B[左移: 00010000 << 1]
    B --> C[结果: 00100000]
    C --> D[右移: 00100000 >> 1]
    D --> E[结果: 00010000]

    subgraph 左移操作
        direction LR
        A --> B --> C
    end

    subgraph 右移操作
        direction LR
        C --> D --> E
    end

Requirements Analysis

According to the description in the question, we have a 16-bit flag used to represent different states. These states are represented by various binary bits, each corresponding to a specific meaning. For example:

  • Whether it failed
  • Is it compressed?
  • Incremental?
  • Is there a follow-up package?
  • Normal request or logout

Implement using bitwise operations

We will use bit operations to set and get these flag bits. Specifically:

  • Get the value of a single bit (0 or 1)
  • Set a bit to 1
  • Set a bit to 0

We first define a flag to store these flags. Then, we use bit operations to check and set the corresponding flags.

C++ example code 

#include <iostream>
#include <bitset>

// 定义标志位常量
const unsigned short BIT_0_FAIL = 1 << 0;    // bit0 是否失败
const unsigned short BIT_1_COMPRESSED = 1 << 1; // bit1 是否压缩
const unsigned short BIT_2_INCREMENT = 1 << 2;  // bit2 是否增量
const unsigned short BIT_3_HAS_MORE = 1 << 3;   // bit3 是否有后续包
const unsigned short BIT_5_CANCEL = 1 << 5;     // bit5 正常请求(0)或注销(1)

// 检查某一位是否为1
bool isBitSet(unsigned short wInfo, unsigned short bitMask) {
    return (wInfo & bitMask) != 0;
}

// 设置某一位为1
void setBit(unsigned short& wInfo, unsigned short bitMask) {
    wInfo |= bitMask;
}

// 清除某一位（设置为0）
void clearBit(unsigned short& wInfo, unsigned short bitMask) {
    wInfo &= ~bitMask;
}

int main() {
    // 假设wInfo的初始值为0
    unsigned short wInfo = 0;

    // 设置bit0（失败标志）
    setBit(wInfo, BIT_0_FAIL);
    
    // 设置bit1（压缩标志）
    setBit(wInfo, BIT_1_COMPRESSED);
    
    // 打印wInfo的二进制值
    std::cout << "wInfo (in binary): " << std::bitset<16>(wInfo) << std::endl;

    // 检查各个标志位
    std::cout << "bit0 (是否失败): " << (isBitSet(wInfo, BIT_0_FAIL) ? "是" : "否") << std::endl;
    std::cout << "bit1 (是否压缩): " << (isBitSet(wInfo, BIT_1_COMPRESSED) ? "是" : "否") << std::endl;
    std::cout << "bit2 (是否增量): " << (isBitSet(wInfo, BIT_2_INCREMENT) ? "是" : "否") << std::endl;
    std::cout << "bit3 (是否有后续包): " << (isBitSet(wInfo, BIT_3_HAS_MORE) ? "是" : "否") << std::endl;
    std::cout << "bit5 (是否注销): " << (isBitSet(wInfo, BIT_5_CANCEL) ? "是" : "否") << std::endl;

    // 清除bit1（压缩标志）
    clearBit(wInfo, BIT_1_COMPRESSED);
    
    // 打印更新后的wInfo
    std::cout << "Updated wInfo (in binary): " << std::bitset<16>(wInfo) << std::endl;

    return 0;
}

Run code, recommended by an old friend: https://wandbox.org/

wInfo (in binary): 0000000000000011
bit0 (是否失败): 是
bit1 (是否压缩): 是
bit2 (是否增量): 否
bit3 (是否有后续包): 否
bit5 (是否注销): 否
Updated wInfo (in binary): 0000000000000001

Code explanation

  1. Using bitwise operations (shifting, ANDing, ORing, XORing, etc.), we assign each flag a unique binary position

  2. The bolded and italicized elements are not part of the translation. Here’s the translation: It is a matter of great importance.

  3. Set the specific flag bit to 1

  4. To set a specific flag bit to 0

Summary

Bit manipulation allows for efficient handling of multiple status flags. This technique is particularly useful in practical development, such as embedded systems, network protocols, and system state management, where bit flags are often used to represent multiple binary states, saving space and improving efficiency.

This blog post aims to help you understand how to use bitwise operations in C++ for bit manipulation and setting. Mastering these skills is very helpful for writing efficient and maintainable code!

item.title: Occasional disk recognition issues due to too many disks installed on ASUS Z490 motherboards
item.description:
Following on from the previous discussion, I encountered an issue where the wireless network card was not being recognized. Before rebuilding the partitions, I also researched other solutions online, such as removing the motherboard battery and disconnecting power for fifteen minutes; or upgrading to the latest BIOS driver—but all of these proved problematic.

Thinking there were still things to deal with, I switched to a limited network and ran the ethernet cable from the living room to the room. Then the problem reappeared – the wired network wasn’t recognized either. I tried a drastic measure: reinstalling the system, which resulted in a missing partition error. If this had been happening consistently, I wouldn’t have bothered troubleshooting for so long. This ASUS disk conflict seems intermittent and triggered by unstable system restarts.

Last week, a new disk was added to the desktop – a 2TB solid-state drive from Yangtze Memory (YMTC), M.2 interface. The machine hasn’t been restarted since then until it was shut down yesterday.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are.

Reinstall system

It’s been two years since I last reinstalled the system. The C drive is full, and Windows has its usual issues – various software likes to store things on the C drive. So, I decided to reinstall the system. After reinstalling, the network card issue was resolved, and I restored my development environment the next day. Just as I was preparing a system backup, a new problem arose: the boot partition is missing after restarting the system.

Following the steps from the previous article, I rebuilt the boot partition, but it’s unstable. It might not load after a reboot. I initially suspected issues with the case, then checked the hard drive cable connections several times, but everything seems fine.

Memory revival

Many years ago, this machine had an SSD installed using a PCIe adapter (plugged into the graphics card slot) instead of directly connecting it to the motherboard. This time, installing it directly on the motherboard might indicate a motherboard issue.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are.

Motherboard manual

The motherboard manual contains an error: the labeled SATA port locations do not match the actual locations. With multiple disks installed in all available ports (many of which are older SSDs using SATA), and according to the manual, there’s a conflict between these ports. Testing revealed this conflict is triggered intermittently, causing the affected disk to fail to load. This is problematic as it’s the system disk with the boot files, resulting in boot failures.

Solution

Reinstalling the solid-state drive on the PCIe adapter resolves conflicts with the motherboard’s SATA ports, allowing the system to boot normally

item.title: Unveiling the Secrets of ESP Partition, GPT Partition Table, and the Windows Operating Systems Collaboration
item.description:
Yesterday, after work, I got home and turned on my desktop. The system booted normally, but the wireless network card failed to load. Thinking the card might be loose, I opened the case and reinstalled it. This made things much worse; now the system won’t boot at all, and the bootloader has failed.

It’s been a while since I worked with desktop computers, so partitioning feels a bit unfamiliar. I used DisGenius to create a new blank partition (usually at the beginning of the disk) and allocated it as an ESP partition (defaulting to 300M). Then, I rebuilt the boot from within the PE system. Relevant information can be found online.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are.

Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are.

In the world of computer storage, ESP partitions, GPT partition tables, and Windows operating systems are closely linked, each playing a unique and crucial role in supporting stable system operation and efficient management. Before delving into them, however, it’s necessary to mention the “pioneer” in the history of computer partitioning – the MBR partition table format. It reflects the evolution of technology by contrasting with later innovations. Today, let’s explore their intrinsic connections and intricacies.

MBR Partition Table – The “Foundation” of Traditional Disk Partitioning

MBR, short for Master Boot Record, has existed since the early days of personal computers and dominated the hard drive partitioning field for decades

Basic architecture

It is located in the first sector of the hard drive, also known as sector 0, and occupies 512 bytes. These 512 bytes are primarily divided into three parts: firstly, the boot program code, responsible for loading the operating system’s boot loader during computer startup, typically 446 bytes; secondly, the disk partition table, occupying 64 bytes, which can define up to 4 primary partition entries, each entry using 16 bytes to record parameters such as starting head, sector, cylinder, and partition type and size; finally, the last 2 bytes are the MBR termination flag “55 AA”, used to identify this sector as a valid MBR.

Historical achievements and limitations

Initially, the MBR partition table adequately met the relatively simple storage needs of personal computers. It allowed operating systems to smoothly recognize hard drive partitions for orderly data storage and retrieval. However, as technology evolved, its limitations became increasingly apparent. On one hand, constrained by a 64-byte partition table space, it could only support a maximum of four primary partitions; creating more required the use of extended and logical partitions, adding complexity to disk management. On the other hand, with a maximum capacity of only 2TB, it struggled to keep pace with today’s high-capacity drives—often several terabytes or even dozens—becoming a bottleneck for further storage technology development.

ESP Partition – The System’s “Invisible Boot Key”

ESP, short for EFI System Partition, is a special partition required on computers using the UEFI (Unified Extensible Firmware Interface) standard

Features

  • When a computer powers on, the UEFI firmware first locates the ESP partition on the hard drive and reads the boot loader stored there (such as Windows Boot Manager), thereby initiating the operating system. It’s like a precise key that unlocks the gateway to system startup; without it, the system would be lost and confused at boot time.
  • The ESP partition also stores essential drivers needed during system startup, ensuring that hardware devices (such as disk controllers and graphics cards) function correctly in the early boot phase, laying the foundation for the subsequent operating system to take over smoothly

Space requirements and format

Typically, the ESP partition is recommended to be between 100MB and 500MB; allocating around 200MB usually suffices for basic needs. Its file system format must be FAT32 because UEFI firmware can only recognize this format for reading boot files, ensuring compatibility and cross-platform support.

GPT Partition Table – The “Smart Manager” of Your Hard Drive

GPT (GUID Partition Table), or Global Unique Identifier Partition Table, is a new partitioning scheme designed to replace traditional MBR partition tables

Advantages revealed

  • In today’s era of data explosion, high-capacity hard drives are constantly emerging. The GPT partition table overcomes the 2TB capacity limitation of MBR and theoretically supports up to 9.4 ZB (Zettabytes) – an extremely large storage space enabling massive data storage.
  • Unlike MBR, which limits partitioning to a maximum of four primary partitions, GPT allows for up to 128 partitions, providing users and system administrators with great flexibility—whether it’s dividing multiple system or data partitions, or reserving partitions for specific purposes
  • The GPT partition table utilizes a redundant backup mechanism, storing partition information in both the hard drive header and tail. This allows the system to automatically recover from another backup if one partition table is damaged, significantly reducing the risk of data loss due to partition table failure and ensuring data security.

Structural Analysis

The GPT partition table consists of several parts, including a protective MBR (retained for BIOS compatibility but not used for actual partitioning), a GPT header (storing basic information about the partition table, such as version, number of partitions, and table size), and an array of partition entries (each entry detailing key information like start/end sectors, GUID type, and unique identifier). These structures work together to precisely plan and manage disk space.

Windows Operating System – A “Digital Interaction Space” for Users

Windows, a widely used operating system worldwide, builds a user-friendly bridge between people and computer hardware

Integration with ESP partitions and GPT partition tables

During the Windows installation process on UEFI-based systems, the installer automatically creates an EFI System Partition (ESP) and deploys boot files to it. The hard drive is initialized with a GPT partition table, creating a system reserved partition (similar to the system boot file area in traditional BIOS), a Windows system partition (where core system files are installed), and other user-defined data partitions. Windows relies on the GPT partition table to accurately identify each partition, enabling smooth startup through the ESP, ensuring seamless integration for a fluid user experience.

System management and optimization foundation

Windows leverages the advantages of GPT partition tables for disk management during operation. For example, the Disk Management tool can easily identify GPT partitions, allowing users to conveniently create, delete, format, and resize them – meeting diverse data storage needs at different stages. System updates, software installations, and other processes are also closely related to the partition layout; a well-planned partitioning scheme helps improve system performance and stability, reducing issues caused by insufficient disk space or partition confusion.

Practical Tips: Maintenance and Troubleshooting

Understanding their close relationship makes daily maintenance and troubleshooting much more systematic

Disk space management

Regularly check the ESP partition space to avoid issues caused by insufficient space due to excessive startup items or software installations, which can affect system boot. For data partitions under GPT, plan storage effectively and promptly clear unnecessary files to prevent full partitions from impacting system operation.

Troubleshoot startup issues

If the system fails to boot, first check the ESP partition for corruption or missing files. You can use the UEFI firmware’s built-in startup repair tool or enter a Windows recovery environment using the installation media to rebuild the ESP partition’s boot files. If you suspect a GPT partition table failure, use professional disk tools (such as DiskGenius) to check the integrity of the partition table and attempt to repair/restore backup partition information to recover lost partitions.

ESP partitions, GPT partition tables, and the Windows operating system work like a precise team, each playing their part to create a stable and efficient computing environment. Understanding them not only helps us confidently install and maintain systems but also allows us to grasp the underlying logic of computers and navigate the digital world with ease. Reflecting on the rise and fall of the MBR partition table further highlights the power of technological progress, which drives storage technology forward to meet ever-increasing data storage demands.

item.title: Understanding GCC, GLIBC, and C++ Program Compatibility Issues
item.description:
In C++ development, GCC and GLIBC are essential components, and compatibility issues after program release often trouble developers. This article will delve into their nature, explore the root causes of compatibility problems, and discuss corresponding solutions.

I. GCC: A Powerful Compiler Foundation

  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • GCC, the GNU Compiler Collection, is an open-source compiler suite developed by the GNU project. It’s far more than a typical compiler; it supports numerous mainstream languages including C, C++, Objective-C, Fortran, Ada, and Go, providing a one-stop solution for cross-language development.
  • Taking C++ as an example, when we write a source file containing complex features such as classes, templates, and function overloading, GCC can convert the high-level C++ code into instruction sequences that the underlying machine can understand and execute, based on C++’s strict syntax and semantic rules. This process involves multiple fine-grained stages including lexical analysis, syntactic analysis, semantic analysis, optimization, and code generation.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • GCC first preprocesses the source file. During this process, it handles all directives, and after preprocessing, the source file is initially expanded.
  • After preprocessing, the file enters the compilation stage. GCC, based on the C++ language standard, converts the source file into assembly code. It carefully checks the code structure, ensuring correct class inheritance, polymorphism implementation, and function call parameter matching. If any errors violating syntax or semantics are detected, it will promptly report them and terminate the compilation process. For example, if there is a mismatch between the function declaration and definition’s parameter list, GCC will precisely indicate the issue.
  • The assembler converts the assembly code generated in the previous step into machine code, producing a target file with a INLINE_CODE_0 extension. These target files contain binary instructions that can be directly executed by the machine, but they cannot run independently because a complete program typically consists of multiple modules with unresolved function and variable references.
  • This is the final sprint to generate an executable file. The linker integrates multiple object files and required library files (static or dynamic libraries). For example, when using container classes from the C++ Standard Template Library, the linker needs to find the corresponding library implementation code to ensure that functions like __INLINE_CODE_0__BOLD_3list can be correctly called at runtime, ultimately generating a complete executable program.

II. GLIBC: The Backbone Behind C++ Program Execution

  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • GLIBC, or the GNU C Library, is a specific implementation of the C standard library within the GNU ecosystem. Although its name highlights C, C++ programs are equally reliant on it, as C++ inherits much from C’s foundation. It provides a vast array of fundamental functions, such as those for memory management, and frequently appears in early C++ development and scenarios demanding high performance and conciseness.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • GLIBC acts as a crucial bridge between the operating system and applications. In Linux systems, when a C++ program makes a system call—for example, to open a file (using a function that relies on GLIBC implementation)—GLIBC encapsulates the program’s request in the manner specified by the operating system kernel, passes it to the kernel, and returns the result to the application after the kernel has processed it. This allows applications to use various system resources—such as file systems, networks, and process management—without needing to understand the complex details of the underlying system call interfaces.

Compatibility Issues After C++ Program Release

  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • Different Linux distributions often use different versions of GLIBC. When a C++ program is compiled in a high-version GLIBC environment, it may inadvertently utilize new functions or rely on optimized implementations introduced in that version. For example, newer GLIBC versions improve memory allocation algorithms, and programs frequently leverage these improvements for performance gains. If such a program is ported to a system with an older GLIBC version, it may encounter missing function errors (because the function wasn’t introduced in the older version) or abnormal function behavior (due to discrepancies between old and new implementations), leading to crashes or incorrect results.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • Even when using the same GCC compiler, different versions exhibit variations in code generation, standard library support, and implementation details of C++ features. Newer GCC versions may offer complete support for the latest C++ standards (e.g., modules and coroutines in C++20). Compiling programs utilizing these advanced features with older GCC versions can result in errors due to unrecognized syntax; even without syntactic errors, differing optimization strategies across GCC versions can lead to significantly different machine code performance—affecting execution efficiency and memory usage—potentially causing vastly different behavior in demanding scenarios.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • C++ programs may need to run on different hardware architectures, such as x86, ARM, and PowerPC. These architectures have their own unique instruction sets, memory layouts, and data alignment requirements. For example, a structure’s data storage layout that runs correctly on the x86 architecture can cause abnormal memory access and program errors on the ARM architecture due to different alignment rules. Furthermore, GCC generates significantly different machine code when compiling for different architectures; if the program contains hardcoded architecture-specific instructions or assumptions, cross-architecture runtime failures are inevitable.

Strategies for Addressing Compatibility Issues

  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • Consider using a static library, which packages the program’s dependencies (e.g., GLIBC) directly into the executable file. This eliminates runtime dependency on specific GLIBC versions, effectively preventing issues caused by version mismatches. However, static linking significantly increases the executable size and requires weighing the pros and cons in scenarios with limited storage resources.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • By leveraging containerization technologies like Docker, the C++ program and its required runtime environment (including specific versions of GCC, GLIBC, etc.) are encapsulated within a standalone container. This ensures consistent execution environments regardless of the underlying operating system, simplifying cross-environment deployment significantly.
  1. Please provide the Chinese text you want me to translate. I am ready when you are!
  • Establish a comprehensive compatibility testing system covering various GLIBC versions, GCC versions, and common system architectures. Through continuous integration tools, conduct regular automated testing in multiple environments during development. Address any compatibility issues promptly to eliminate potential risks early on and ensure stability upon release.

Thoroughly understanding the workings of GCC and GLIBC, accurately identifying the root causes of C++ compatibility issues, and skillfully applying solutions are essential skills for every C++ developer aiming to build robust, cross-platform applications. Only then can our C++ works navigate diverse technical ecosystems smoothly.
